loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en: Eugenie is 36 years old and has seven children aged 1 to 16. Three of the children attend school. She sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for six years. She would like a loan to buy more sorghum, beans, and maize to sell in her store.  Profits will be used to renovate her house. She would like to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum, beans, and maize.

loans.name: Godereve

texts.en: Godereve is 23 years old and has one child aged two months. She sells foodstuffs and other items in a store she has run for two years. She would like a loan to buy cooking oil, rice, flour, and children's clothing to sell in her store. The extra profits will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, rice, flour, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to have general maintenance work carried out on his motorbike

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: La socia tiene 2 hijos de 35 y 31 años de edad; actualmente se dedica  a la atencion de su negocio, la socia acaba de poner un pequeño local frente a la universidad Nacional de Cusco; y su local esta junto a una imprenta, ella esta acomodando su negocio y requiere implementarlo con vitrinas, y terminar de hacer la instalacion electrica, la socia se esta dedicando a la venta de mazamorras y arroz con leche, la socia en esta ocasion desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de vitrinas para acomodar algunos kekes y contratar a un tecnico para terminar la instalacion de luz en su nuevo local.
texts.en: The client has 2 children ages 35 and 31 years old. Currently she is working to improve her business, and just installed a small shop in front of the National University of Cusco, near a printing store. She is trying to make her shop more comfortable, and so wants to install shelving units and electricity. She works selling porridge and rice with milk (a local dessert). She will invest the loan in the purchase of glass shelving to hold cakes and to hire a technician to finish installing lights in her new shop.

loans.use: to purchase glass shelving and to hire a technician to finish installing lights in her new shop.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 20 years old and single. She sells spare parts for bicycles and has been doing so for one year. She would like a loan to buy more spare bicycle parts to sell. The extra profits will be used to renovate her family’s home.

loans.use: To buy more spare bicycle parts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bulk maize and rice.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 23 years old and has a child aged  one. She has been running a store for the last three years where she sells clothes, shoes, and lotions.  She would like a loan to buy more clothes, shoes, and lotions to sell. The profits will be used to buy a cow which will provide milk for the family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 32 years old and has four children aged 5 to 11. Three of her children are currently in school. Her husband works as a mechanic. Beatrice sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for six years. She would like a loan to buy more beans, maize, and tomatoes to sell in her shop. The profits will be used to buy a cow to provide milk for her family. Her dream is to one day buy a car.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Maria Nidia

texts.es:
La señora Nidia a sus 43 años de edad,  inicia desde hace dos años su pequeño negocio de cría de cerdos y engorde de pollos en una vereda del municipio de Sopetran ubicado al occidente de Antioquia,  luego de tener la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos puesto que el padre de sus dos hijos la abandonó, quedando ella sola con la responsabilidad del hogar.  La señora Nidia decide emprender en su propia casa este negocio con el fin de estar al cuidado de sus hijos. Todo lo aplicado en su negocio es gracias a su madre quien toda su vida se ha dedicado a esta labor y le enseño todo lo relacionado a este trabajo a su hija.
En el negocio le colaboran sus dos hijos en los tiempos libres, quienes se encuentran estudiando gracias al trabajo de su madre. La hija mayor de Nidia de 20 años de edad ingresará a la Universidad y el hijo menor de 17 años de edad está terminando el bachillerato, por estos motivos la señora Nidia desea comprar 50 pollos, 3 cerdos, cuido para la alimentación de los animales y adecuaciones locativas en el arreglo del piso de su negocio para tener mayores ventas, incrementar sus ingresos  y de esta manera seguir cumpliendo todas las responsabilidades en su hogar y de su familia que están a cargo de ella.
texts.en:
Nidia is 43 years old.  Two years ago she started her own small business raising pigs and fattening chickens in Sopetran which is located to the west of Antioquia.  She needed to make her own income as the father of her two children abandoned her, leaving her alone with responsibility for her household.  Nidia decided to start this business in her own home so that she could care for her children.  All the knowledge she applies to her business is thanks to her mother who also carried out this type of work and taught her daughter everything about the business.

Nidia's two children help her with her business in their free time.  They are both studying thanks to their mother's work.  Nidia's eldest [daughter] is 20 years old and will enter university.  Her youngest [son] is 17 years old and is finishing high school.  For this reason, Nidia would like to buy 50 chickens, 3 pigs and feed for her animals.  She will also make some structural improvements by fixing the floor of her business so that she can make more sales, increase her income and, in this way, continue fulfilling her household responsibilities and taking care of her family who are dependent on her.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens and to make some structural improvements to the floor of her business

loans.name: Ciomurumia

texts.en:
Ciomurumia is married and has eight children ranging from twenty-nine to forty years old. She describes herself as ambitious. She runs a general store where she sells household and farm products. She has been in this business for eight years.The business is faced with the challenge of increased price of goods.

She will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to add to her stock of farm and household goods. In the next five years, Ciomurumia wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To add to her stock of farm products and household goods.

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.es: La socia Etelvina actualmente se dedcia  a la preparación y venta de rocoto relleno, la socia es una mujer muy emprendedora y ahora esta con su negocio de venta de rocotos de forma independiente y ambulatoria, la socia compra al por mayor rocotos, los limpia, prepara el relleno y con una capa de ponche de harina con huevo lo enrrolla, en otra olla sancocha las papas y luego lleva en un olla con servilletas y manteles bien envueltos a vender a los difernetes clientes que ya la conocen y saben de su rica sazón. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de rocotos al por mayor, y de ingredientes para la elaboracion de los famosos rocotos rellenos acompañados con papa sancochada.
texts.en: Etelvina currently makes and sells stuffed hot peppers for a living. She is a very enterprising woman and her business selling hot peppers is now independent and mobile.  She buys hot peppers wholesale, cleans them, prepares the filling, and she rolls them in a layer of flour mixed with egg.  In another pot she boils potatoes and then she takes everything in a pot wrapped up really well along with napkins and table cloths to sell to her different customers who know her and know her food tastes good.  She is asking for a loan to buy hot peppers wholesale as well as ingredients to make her famous stuffed peppers with boiled potatoes.

loans.use: to buy hot peppers wholesale and to buy potatoes and other ingredients.

loans.name: María's Group

texts.es:
María's Group está conformada por tres mujeres emprendedoras, en este grupo la presidenta es María porque ella es una mujer cariñosa, amable, sociable y buena. Vive con sus 4 hijos en Salcedo que se encuentra a una media hora de Latacunga en la Sierra Centro de Ecuador.

María se dedica a la comercialización de jugos y espumilla que es la clara del huevo y el jugo de cualquier fruto batido. Es la primera vez que trabaja con Fodemi, el crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de frutos para aumentar su producción, lo que le ayudará a obtener buenos ingresos y así podrá darles el estudio a sus hijas.

Su sueño es poder ver a sus hijas profesionales y que su negocio siga creciendo economicamente.

Las otras dos personas del grupo se dedican a la confección de ropa y el crédito les servirá para comprar materia prima (tela de punto).
texts.en:
María's Group consists of 3 enterprising women. The president of the group is Maria because she is a loving, kind, sociable and good woman. She lives with her 4 children in Salcedo which is about half an hour away from Latacunga in the Sierra Centro of Ecuador. 

Maria produces juices and 'espumilla' which is egg white blended with any fruit. This is the first time she has worked with Fodemi. The loan she is asking for will be invested in buying fruit to increase production, which will help her obtain a good income and allow her to educate her daughters. 

Her dream is to see her daughters as professionals and that her business continue to grow economically.

The other two members of the group manufacture clothing and will use the loan to buy raw materials (knitted fabric)..

loans.use: to buy fruit to increase production.

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
La señora Ana tiene 54 años D. edad, es casada con cuatro hijos.
Ella aprendo los trabajos D. la agricultura, desD. hace 40 años D. edad. Fue su padre quien le enseño. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. a darle D. comer a sus animales y ha orD.ñar las vacas. Luego se va junto con su esposo a trabajar en sus cultivos durante toda la mañana, después se regresan a la casa a elaborar queso y en la tarD. lo sale a vender a pie en la comunidad y recorre 6 kilómetros.  
Ana compra los insumos agrícolas en una ciudad del oriente del país, para esto el debe caminar a pie durante dos horas aproximadamente son 5 kilómetros hasta abordar el autobús que lo conduce al lugar donD. compra los insumos agrícolas para su cosechas y alimento para el ganado, luego se regresa a la casa con los insumos a pie.
Ana esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar abono, pesticidas, entre otros y alimento para su ganado. Al comprar los insumos D. una sola vez, la señora Ana estará segura D. dar a sus cultivos y a sus animales un manejo adecuado y oportuno; esto permitirá obtener una buena cosecha, lo mismo que el aumento D. su producción D. leche y recibir mejores ingresos. 
Ana ahorrara D. sus ingresos para comprar más vacas lecheras. Para incrementar sus ingresos y construir una casa D. ladrillo, ya que en la que vive es D. lamina.
texts.en:
Ana is 54 years old, married and has four children.  Her father taught her how to farm, which she has done for fourteen years.  She wakes up at 4:00 a.m. to feed her animals milk the cows.  Then she and her husband go out to work in their crops for the rest of the morning.  After that, the return home to make cheese and in the afternoon they walk six kilometers on foot to sell it in their community. 

Ana buys her farm supplies in a city located in the eastern part of the country.  To get there, she walks two hours (roughly 5 kilometers) and takes a bus the rest of the way. She then buys supplies for her crops and food for her cattle and returns home on foot with the supplies. 

Ana is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo in order to buy fertilizer, pesticides and food for her livestock.  By purchasing her supplies all at once, Ana is able to make sure her crops and animals are managed properly and in a timely manner. This will make possible a successful harvest, greater milk production and higher earnings.  

Ana will put money asiD. from her earnings to buy more dairy cows so that she can increase her income and build a brick home, as her current home is maD. of galvanized tin.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, pesticide and feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Domina

texts.en: Domina is 41 years old and has one child who is age 17. Her child is currently in school. She sells spare parts for bicycles and motorcycles in a store that she has run for eight years. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts to be available for sale in her store. The extra profits will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more spare bicycle and motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is married and has two children who are six and nine years old. She describes herself as honest and principled. She operates a boutique where she sells clothing to retail customers. She has been in this business for three years. Her business faces the problem of inadequate funds to add to the stock. She will be using the loan of 20,000 KES to buy more clothes for the boutique. In the future, she looks forward to expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell in her boutique.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 43 years old and has one child aged 13. She sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for six years. She would like a loan to buy beans, sorghum, and maize to sell in her shop. Florence will use the profits to create savings for her future.

loans.use: To buy more beans, sorghum, and maize.

loans.name: Patient Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Patient” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Lunsar, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 800,000 SLL for each in the group in order to invest in their respective businesses.  

Isata is the leader of the group. She is thirty-five years of age. Isata is married to an elections officer and the couple has three children. She sells cloth, earrings, etc. and has been doing business for many years now. Isata is going to use her share of the loan to buy cosmetics, cloth, jewelry, etc. to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, cloth, jewelry, etc. to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa  is a fishmonger at Kwahinkrom. She has done this for five years. She is married to an electrician and has five  dependents. She uses her income to help her husband in providing for their family.  Adjoa will use her loan to purchase bulk fish. Adjoa plan to expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: purchase bulk fish.

loans.name: Mario Pedro

texts.es: La señor Mario  es cliente antiguo de la institución desde el año 2004 empezó en el grupo solidario Raza de Bronce  quien ha trabajado con responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus cuotas. Actualmente vive en la ciudad del Alto  tiene casa propia, el solo mantiene su hogar,  se dedica a la venta de repuestos usados para movilidades, se dedica a esta actividad hace ya bastantes años,  el préstamo lo  invertirá en la compra de repuestos para movilidad, ya que desea surtir su tienda y así ofrecer variedad de repuestos a sus clientes, se siente muy feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señor Mario is a long-standing member of the institution since 2004. He started with the solidarity group Raza de Bronce and made his repayments responsibly and punctually. He currently lives in the city of Alto. He owns his own house and only takes care of himself. He sells used spare parts for cars. He has been doing this work for a long time. He will invest the loan to purchase spare parts for cars as he wants to stock his store and thus offer a variety of spare parts to his customers. He is very happy with and grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to stock his store.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en: Claire is 29 years old and has three children aged 6 to 11. One of her children is currently in school. She sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for six years. Claire would like a loan to buy beans, sorghum, and maize to increase the volume of her business. Profits will be used to renovate her house. She would like to own a car in the future which would help expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more beans, sorghum and maize to sell.

loans.name: Sabina Thairora

texts.en: Sabina, 42 years old, is married and has five children ranging from fifteen to twenty-nine years. She describes herself as ambitious. Sabina runs a grocery store. She has been in this business for five years and faces a challenge of transportation when buying the goods. She will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to add stock to the grocery store. Sabina wants in the future to expand the business by increasing her turnover.

loans.use: To add stock to the grocery store.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina, D.  40 años D. edad, esta casada con Dionicio D. 41 años, con quien tiene 5 hermosos hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito D. Pichari. Para delfina, el factor más relevante es “la creatividad y la perseverancia continua”; desD. luego lo implementó, cuanto tuvo sus primeras cosechas, pero ella quería ambicionar a más, para que D. esa manera brinD. seguridad a su familia. Actualmente se dedica al cultivo y producción D. café, actividad que le esta yendo bien, puesto que sus compradores potenciales se sienten muy satisfechos por la calidad del producto agrícola que los ofrece. Normalmente trabaja en compañía D. su familia, y juntos hacen un buen equipo D. trabajo, además asegura que minimiza en gastos, ya que no necesita D. mano D. obra D. terceras personas. Usualmente su producto D. café los venD. en los centros D. acopio del distrito D. Pichari. 
Este será su segundo credito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago D. sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la limpieza D. las malezas D. su parcela agrícola
texts.en:
40-year-old Delfina is married to 41-year-old Dionicio with whom she has five beautiful children.  They live together in their own home which is located in Pichari district.  For Delfina, the most important factor is "continual creativity and perseverance" and she implemented this with her first harvests.  However, she wanted to achieve more so that she could proviD. her family with security.  She currently grows and produces coffee.  Her business is doing well as her potential buyers feel very satisfied with the quality of the produce that she offers them.  Delfina normally works with her family and they work well as a team.  In addition, she says that it minimizes expenses as she doesn't need labor from other people.  Delfina usually sells her coffee at the storage warehouses in Pichari district.

This will be Delfina's second loan from MFP and she pledges to make her repayments on time.  She will use the 1,500 soles to invest in clearing the weeds from her plot of farmland.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for weeding her land

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr: Monsieur Issa est âgé de 40 ans. Il vit dans une des banlieues sénégalaises. Il est marié et père d’un enfant  âgé de 4 ans. Il exerce une double activité de photographe et de commerçant. Il capitalise une expérience de 23 ans dans le métier de photographe et 17 ans dans l’activité de commerce. Il a choisi de développer son activité de photographe dans laquelle il a acquis beaucoup d’expérience  a travers les revenus que lui procure son  commerce, activité  qu’il a choisi par amour. Son intention est  de mieux développer son activité de photographe et fructifier  ses revenus personnels. Il est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité depuis 2003. Il sollicite un crédit de 300000 prévu pour l’achat de tissus à revendre. il souhaite renforcer son chiffre d’affaire et améliorer les conditions  de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Issa is 40 years old and lives in one of the suburbs of Senegal. He is married and the father of a 4-year-old child. He has dual work, photography and commerce. He has been capitalizing on 23 years of experience as a photographer and 17 years as a merchant. He chose to develop his photography business, in which he has acquired a lot of experience, though the revenues gotten from commerce, which he chose out of his love for it. He intends to develop his photography business further and to do well in expanding his personal income. 

Mr. Issa has been a member of the U-IMCEC branch in his town since 2003. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 for buying fabrics to sell. He wishes to bolster his sales figures and to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cloth to resell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and has five children aged 1 to 21.  Her husband works as a farmer.  She has been selling foodstuffs for six years.  

Josephine would like a loan to buy more sorghum and beans to sell.  The profits will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum and beans to sell.

loans.name: Reformed B Group

texts.en:
Benard is the facilitator of the Reformed B group. Benard and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Benard takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to receive One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family by harvesting more. In the recent 2011 season, Benard had a very good maize yield harvesting six bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Benard was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Benard and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Benard will educate his children, save for the future and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Reformed B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Benard is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dishes, cups, plates, plastic bowls, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr: Monsieur Moustapha  habite au Sénégal. C’est un jeune divorcé  de 28 ans qui est père d’un garçon de 10 mois et d’une fille qui vivent sous sa charge. Il s’active dans le secteur  tertiaire  de  la prestation de services  depuis 2009. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est l’informatique qu’il pratique et le Relation ship  qui découle de son contact avec la clientèle. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juin 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de 200000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’une imprimante qui lui permettra  de renforcer son chiffre d’affaire et d’assurer une bonne rentabilité de ses investissements. Son objectif final est d’élargir son marché et arriver à s’autofinancer.
texts.en:
Mr. Mustafa lives in Senegal. He is a young 28-year-old divorced father of a 10-month-old boy and a girl, both living under his care.

Since 2009 he has been active in the third sector providing services. What interests him most is working with computers and developing relations though his contacts with customers. He has been a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches since June 2011.

He is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs he will use to purchase a printer. This will enable him to increase his turnover and ensure a good return on investment. His ultimate goal is to expand his customer base and reach a state of self-financing.

loans.use: buy a printer

loans.name: Amba Shg Group

texts.en:
Stephen is the facilitator of the Amba SHG group. Stephen and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Stephen and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Stephen takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Stephen had a very good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Stephen was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from his maize sales, Stephen will educate his children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Amba SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Stephen pictured together with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr: Madame Ngoné vit au Sénégal. Elle est âgée   de 54 ans. Elle est  mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 8 et 30 ans. Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce  de produit de bétail depuis 1991. La raison du choix de son activité est sa volonté de satisfaire les besoins sociaux de ses enfants étant donné que leur père est décédé.  Donc le plus intéressant  pour elle  reste l’aspect lucratif de son activité. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 5 mois. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits de bétail  qu’elle compte revendre. Ce prêt va contribuer a  financer   son activité ce  qui est un moyen de vouloir lutter contre la pauvreté et entretenir sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Ngoné lives in Senegal. She is 54 years old. She is married and the mother of five children ranging from eight to 30 years of age. Since 1991, she has been  selling animal products. The reason she chose this business was her desire to provide for her children’s socioeconomic needs, given that their father is deceased. Therefore this business mostly attracts her through its profitability. She has been a member of one of the U-IMCEC branches since five months ago. She is seeking a credit of 100,000 West African francs in order to buy animal products for resale. This loan will strengthen the financing of her business, which is her means of fighting against poverty and supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy animal products for resale

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es:
La señora Rosalinda comenta que como tiene que caminar largas distancias diariamente para ir a comprar los artículos que necesita para surtir su negocio de comida. Para Ella ya es muy necesario un carro y así poder realizar estas tareas diarias sin ningún problema.
Este negocio de venta de comida lo tiene desde hace cinco años, su esposo trabaja de auxiliar de un taller mecánico y entre los dos solventan los gastos familiares y escolares de su hijo.
texts.en:
Rosalinda says that she has to walk long distances every day to go and buy the items that she needs to stock her food business.  She very much needs a car so that she can carry out these daily tasks without problems.

Rosalinda has had her food sales business for five years.  Her husband works as an assistant in an auto repair shop and, between the two of them, they cover their family expenses and the education expenses of their son.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and a car to use in her business

loans.name: Sinoko A Group

texts.en:
Patrick is the facilitator of the Sinoko A group. Patrick and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Patrick takes care of 11 children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to receive One Acre Fund’s best prices and to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Patrick had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Patrick was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Patrick and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Patrick will educate his children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Sinoko A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Patrick is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy materials for the Tinga Tinga paints.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es: Dionisio de 41 años de edad, casado con delfina 39 años de edad, que fruto de este amor que se tienen, el resultado son 5 hermosos hijos. Junto habitan en el distrito de Pichari. Dionisio desde muy joven empezó ayudando a sus padres en su actividad agrícola, pero el tenía la meta de tener su propio negocio, que es el tener una tienda. Sin embargo necesita de capital para montar una, así que siguio la actividad tradicional de la familia. Desde entocnes cultiva y produce cacao y estebia, por lo cual está obteniendo buenos resultandos económicos, sin embargo, necesita trabajar más para obtener más dinero y así tener su tienda de abarrotes para que sea su esposa quien lo administre. Por lo general Dionicio trabaja con la ayuda de sus peones quienes le facilitan en la extracción de sus productos, para luego comercializarlos en el distrito de Pichari. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que Dionicio se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles comprará fertilizantes para sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
41-year-old Dionisio is married to 39-year-old Delfina.  As the fruit of their love, they have five beautiful children and they live together in Pichari district.  When he was very young, Dionisio started helping his parents with their farming.  He had a goal of owning his own business (a store) but needed capital to set one up.  For this reason, he continued working in the family's traditional business.  He grows and produces cacao and stevia which give him good financial results.  However, he needs to work more in order to make more money so that he can set up a grocery store for his wife to run.  In general, Dionisio works with the help of farm laborers who help him to pick his crops so that he can sell them in Pichari district.

This will be Dionisio's second loan from MFP.  He pledges once more to make his repayments punctually.  He will use his 1,500 soles to buy fertilizers for his cacao fields.

loans.use: to buy sacks of natural fertilizer

loans.name: Wabukhonyi Shg Group

texts.en:
Dominic is the facilitator of the Wabukhonyi SHG group. Dominic and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Dominic takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to receive One Acre Fund’s best prices and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Dominic had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Dominic was only able to harvest 1½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Dominic and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Dominic will educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Wabukhonyi SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Dominic is pictured with his group members and the field officer is on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sebastien

texts.fr:
Mr  SEBASTIEN est marié et Père de 01 enfant. Il a 02ans et personne ne va à l’école. Il a 03 personnes en charge.

Mr est  gérant d’une boutique de pièces détachées d’engin à deux roux  depuis 10ans. Il s’approvisionne au  yaar du théâtre populaire et au secteur 15 en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes et les enfants.

Il veut  s’acheter  18 pneus pour moto,30 pneus pour vélo et 25 pistons

Mr  utilise ses bénéfices pour  agrandir sa boutique. Il  ambitionne  améliorer son commerce et construire un logement.
texts.en:
Sebastien is married and has a two-year-old child who does not go to school yet.  He also supports three additional persons.  

For 10 years now, Sebastien has managed a retail shop that sells spare motorcycle and bicycle parts.  He buys his products at the "yaar" (street market) in the neighborhood of the People's Theater, as well as in district 15 of the city.  His customers are women, men and children.

He would like to buy 18 motorcycle tires, 30 bicycle tires and 25 pistons.  Sebastien uses his profits to increase the size of his shop.  His goal is to improve his business and to build a house.

loans.use: To buy 18 motorcycle tires, 30 bicycle tires and 25 pistons.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson, de 32 años de edad, convive con Martha de 34 años de edad con quien tiene un hermoso hijo. Desde hace 7 años, Nelson decidió incursionar en la actividad agrícola, específicamente  al cultivo de café y cacao, con el fin de dar felicidad a su familia. En efecto se siente contento con lo que realiza, ya que desde siempre le ha gustado estar insertado en este rubro, no en vano nació y creció en el campo. Él recuerda que empezó de una pequeña parcela de cultivo, hoy en día tiene buenas extensiones de terreno, y esto lo logró gracias al esfuerzo y  tenacidad que tiene. En su parcela agrícola trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa e hijos, pero en épocas de cosecha necesita de algunos peones que le puedan facilitar la extracción de sus productos finales. Usualmente su producto los lleva a la localidad de Pichari, para que así los pueda vender a un precio competitivo. En el futuro piensa adquirir más terrenos de cultivo, con el propósito de aumentar su productividad, y por ende percibir mejores ingresos económicos. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará sacos de abono para fertilizar su campo agrícola.
texts.en: Nelson is 32 years old and lives with Martha, 34 years old, with whom he has 1 beautiful child. Seven years ago, Nelson decided to become a farmer, specifically growing coffee and cocoa, to bring happiness to his family. In fact he feels happy with what he does as he has always liked being in the fields; he wasn't born and brought up in the countryside in vain. He remembers that he started out with a small plot of land. Today he has good tracts of land which he managed to acquire due to his effort and tenacity. He works his farmland together with wife and children but at harvest time he needs a few labourers to make it easier to extract the final products. He usually takes his products to Pichari so he can sell them at a competitive price. In the future he plans on acquiring more farmland with the aim of increasing productivity and making a better income. This will be his 1st loan with MFP and he agrees to make his repayments. With the 1,000 nuevos soles (PEN), he will buy sacks of compost to fertilize his fields.

loans.use: to buy sacks of compost.

loans.name: Gricelda Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Gricelda tiene 33 años de edad, esta acompañada con cuatro hijos.
Ella aprendo los trabajos de la agricultura, desde hace 20 años de edad. Fue su madre quien le enseño. Griselda además  elabora y vende  pupusas y bebidas desde hace 10 años junto con su esposo. Se levantan a las 4:00 a.m. para ir a trabajar a la cosecha,  ellos caminan unos 3 kilómetros. Griselda trabaja 6 horas, luego se regresa a la casa a preparar las cosas para elaborar las pupusas y las vende enfrente del cementerio de la ciudad,  mientras su esposo se queda trabajando en la cosecha. 
Griselda camina a pie durante dos horas aproximadamente dos kilómetros, por quebradas y veredas, para abordar el autobús que la conduce a la ciudad donde compra los insumos agrícolas y la materia prima que necesita para elaborar las pupusas.  
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar abono y quesillo, chicharrón, entre otros insumos para elaborar las pupusas y productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. De esta manera ella no presentara problemas con su cosecha ni con su negocio de venta de pupusas y bebidas, por que dispondrá de materia prima para elaborarlas, lo cual le ayudara para llevar el sustento a su familia. 
Gricelda ahorrara de sus ingresos para comprar vacas lecheras. Para incrementar sus ingresos y brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en: Gricelda is 33 years old and has four children. Her mother taught her how to farm 20 years ago. Gricelda also makes and sells pupusas and drinks. She has been doing this for 10 years together with her husband. The couple get up at 4.00am to go and work on their crops. They walk 3 kilometers to do this. Gricelda works for 6 hours then returns home to prepare what she needs to make her pupusas. She sells her pupusas opposite the town cemetery while her husband continues working on their crops. Gricelda walks for two hours, approximately two kilometers, alongside streams and along sidewalks, to catch the bus that will drive her into the city where she buys her agricultural supplies and the raw materials she needs to make her pupusas. Gricelda is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy manure and also quesillo (soft cheese) and chicharrón (cooked pork meat) and other supplies for making pupusas and products to offer her customers. This will mean that she will not experience problems with her crops or her pupusa and drinks business as she will have the raw materials that she needs available. This will help her to provide for her family. Gricelda will save her income so that she can buy dairy cows in order to increase her income and provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: to buy manure, and also quesillo, chicharrón and other supplies for making pupusas and  products to offer her customers

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La señora Dolores es una persona muy trabajadora que a pesar de haber empezado muy joven a laborar y es maestra pensionada. Decidió seguir siendo productiva por lo cual empezó un negocio de venta por catalogo de cosméticos de belleza, el cual ya cuenta con muchos clientes. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en compra de mercancía para la venta navideña ya que sus clientes el están solicitando productos para dar de regalo. 
Tendrá mayor ganancia en su negocio y sus clientes estarán satisfechos por el servicio tan efectivo y rápido que les ofrecerá.
texts.en:
Dolores is a very hard-working person who started working at a very young age and is a retired teacher.  She decided to continue being productive and so started a business selling beauty products through catalogs.  She already has a lot of customers.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying merchandise for the Christmas period as her customers are requesting products to give as gifts.

Dolores will make more profits in her business and her customers will be satisfied with the efficient and speedy service that she will offer them.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the Christmas season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy three 50kg bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy young white pigs for raising and fattening.

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es: Pascual, de 22 años de edad, soltero, el vive en una vivienda alquilada ubicado en la urbanización de valle dorado del distrito de Pichari. Pascual es un joven entusiasta con unas ganas de sobresalir, dejó los estudios por falta de economía, apenas logró culminar la secundaria en un colegio estatal estudiando de noche y de día trabajaba alquilando motos que gracias a ello obtuvo un pequeño capital, derivándolo en la compra de su propio moto taxi de  segunda mano. Actualmente brinda servicio de transporte a todas partes del distrito de Pichari, los horarios de que tiene más trabajo son a parttir de las 7 hasta las 8.30 de la mañana luego a partir de las 12 del medio día hasta la 1.00 de la tarde. Él está satisfecho con lo que hasta la actualidad viene logrando gracias al esfuerzo, y perseverancia en el trabajo que son los que hacen que pascual continúe en esta labor y el compromiso con sus hermanos menores quienes requieren de su apoyo. En un futuro no descarta continuar sus estudios para de esta manera superarse. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en llevar su moto al taller mecánico para su mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Pascual, age 22, is single and lives in a rented home in a development of the Valle Dorado in the Pichari district. Pascual is a young, enthusiastic man with a desire to excel. He had to stop studying due to lack of funds; he was just barely able to finish secondary school in a state school. He took night classes while working during the day renting motorcycles, which provided him with a small income. He bought his own second-hand motorcycle. He now offers a transportation service to all parts of the Pichari district. He has the most work from 7:00 am to 8:30 am, and then from noon until 1:00 pm. He is happy, because he is succeeding thanks to his hard work and perseverance. This has helped him to keep going. He is also motivated by his obligation to his younger siblings who need his support. For the future, he hasn't ruled out going back to school in order to get ahead. 
This will be his first loan with MFP, so he promises to repay his quotas punctually. With the 1000 nuevos soles, he will invest in bringing his motorcycle to the mechanic for maintenance.

loans.use: to bring his motorcycle in to the mechanic.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bags of rice and gallons of palm-oil to add to her business

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino de 45 años, está casado con Rosa de 44 años, con quien tiene 5 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Cada mañana que despierta  y ve a lo lejos los rayos del sol recuerda que ya son las horas para enrumbar a las labores agrícolas. Gracias a las enseñanzas que le dejó su padre, hoy cultiva y produce cacao y café, productos que han logrado tener posionamiento en el mercado nacionale e internacional.
Asimismo sus produtos son cultivados de manera ogánica utilizando fertilizantes naturales, es por ello que tiene mucha demanda su producción. Ahora Paulino está obteniendo buenos ingresos económicos, esto se debe a la dedicación  en su trabajo. Usualmente trabaja con su pareja, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, pero en temporada de cosecha necesita de algunos peones para que faciliten la extracción de sus productos. En un futuro cercano  incrementará su campo agrícola, de esta manera obtendrá más ganancias. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá para contratar peones y lo ayuden a mantener su campo agícola libre de maleza.
texts.en:
Paulino, age 45, is married to Rosa, age 44. They have five children. They live together in their own home in the Pichari district. Every morning, when he wakes up and sees the distant rays of the sun, he knows it's time to start working on the farm. Thanks to his father's teaching, he now cultivates cocoa and coffee, which he is able to sell nationally and internationally.
He farms organically and with natural fertilizers, so his crops are in great demand. Paulino is currently making a good income, thanks to his dedication to his work. He normally works with Rosa, but sometimes their children help out as well. During the harvest season he needs to hire labourers to help out. In the near future, he will expand his lands in order to make a better income. 
This will be his second loan with MFP, so he promises to pay his quotas punctually. With the 1,500 nuevos soles, he will invest in hiring labourers to help him keep his fields free of weeds.

loans.use: to hire labourers.

loans.name: Francisco Adolfo

texts.es:
El señor Francisco es productor agropecuario en su finca ubicada en el municipio del Santuario al oriente de Antioquia. En su finca tiene animales como gallinas, ganado,  pollos, cabras y peces. El señor Francisco ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a esta labor,la cual le ha permitido salir adelante con la compañía de su familia compuesta por sus tres hijas y su esposa. 
A sus 53 años de edad el señor francisco desea tener un mayor número de ganado que le permita aumentar sus ingresos y de esta manera poder brindarles a sus tres hijas de 10, 15 y 17 años de edad una excelente educación y una calidad de vida maravillosa al lado de su esposa a quien tanto quiere.
texts.en:
Francisco is a livestock producer.  He works on his farm which is located in Santuario, in the east of Antioquia department.  On his farm he has animals such as hens, cattle, chickens, goats and fish.  Francisco has devoted most of his life to this work and it has allowed him to get ahead in life together with his family which consists of his three daughters and his wife.

At 53 years of age, Francisco would like to have more cattle which will allow him to increase his income and thereby provide his three daughters, who are 10, 15 and 17, with an excellent education and to provide both them and his wife (who he loves very much) with a marvelous quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Luís Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Luís tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos.

Él se dedica a reparar vehículos, desde hace 18 años. Este oficio lo aprendió de su padre, se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. a darle de comer a sus animales. Luego se dirige a su taller donde trabaja 8 horas diarias y en la noche él se dedica a reparar pequeños problemas que tenga con vehículos que circulan por donde tiene su pequeño taller ya que es una zona muy transitada y a esa hora no hay ningún taller abierto.

Luís viaja hasta la capital del país, para comprar repuestos de vehículos a bajo precio y debe abordar dos autobuses hasta llegar a su destino. El préstamo será utilizado para comprar herramientas de trabajo para su taller y así ofrecer más servicios de mantenimiento de vehículos y obtener más ganancias.

Luís desea contar con un taller bien equipado con todo lo necesario, para brindar un excelente servicio y dar empleo a otras personas, ya que quiere ampliar su taller.
texts.en:
Mr. Luís is 33 years old and lives with his common-law wife and two children.  He has been in the auto repair business for 18 years and learned the trade from his father.  He gets up at 4:00 a.m. to feed the animals then goes to his repair shop where he works eight hours a day.  At night he handles small auto repairs for vehicles passing by his small workshop during off hours.  It is a busy area and at night no other repair shops are open.

Luís goes to the capital city to buy low cost spare parts and he must take two buses to get there.  The loan will be used to buy work tools for his workshop so he can provide more auto maintenance services and earn more income.

Luís wants to have a well-equipped workshop with everything he needs to provide excellent service.  He also wants to expand and hire more workers.

loans.use: To buy work tools for his repair shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy medicines – eight boxes of Pennadols and two cartons of Amodaqui to add to her business

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda de 36 años, es madre soltera con 3 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Pichari. Yolanda es una mujer emprendedora, que se gana la vida expendiendo refresco y chicha morada. Comenzó con éste negocio hace 3 años, en un inicio no le era tan rentable, hasta que en un momento pensó en dejarlo pero fue más su perseverancia que hasta el día de hoy lo mantiene. Lo que más le gusta de esta labor es de que no es tan trabajoso ni muy pesado, pero si el único inconveniente que tiene es que a veces los productos que ella necesita  para preparar su refresco no fácilmente se puede conseguir. En un futuro desea abrir un local donde pueda expender su refresco porque en la actualidad ella vende en la calle en una pequeña carpa. Este será su segundo créedito con MFP, por lo que se compromete una vez más en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1500 nuevos soles, lo utilizará en el alquiler del local para que en ello pueda expender sus productos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 36 years old, a single mother with 3 children. They live together in her own house located in the district of Pichari.

Yolanda is an entrepreneur who makes a living selling softdrinks and chicha morada (a non-alcoholic drink made from purple corn, fruit and spices). She began this business three years ago and at the start it was not so profitable. She thought of closing it but she persisted, and to this day she still has it.

What she likes the most about this work is that it is not exhausting nor heavy, and the only inconvenience she has is at times she can not easily find the supplies she needs to prepare her drinks.

In the future she wants to open a place where she can sell her beverages because currently she sells in the street under a little canvas awning. 

This will be her second loan through MFP, and she promises to once again make her payments on time. She will use the 1500 soles to pay the rent of the facility where she sells her beverages.

loans.use: to pay the rent of the facility where she sells her beverages

loans.name: Gabriel Jaime

texts.es:
En una vereda en el oriente de Antioquia en el municipio del Carmen de Viboral caracterizado por tener grandes artesanos, se encuentra la vivienda del señor Gabriel quien es un gran experto en la elaboración y comercialización de artesanías en madera orgánica y telares antiguos en compañía de su esposa y una de sus tres hijas, quienes son su gran motivación y apoyo. Esta bella labor de Don Gabriel la lleva a cabo desde hace 20 años durante los cuales ha participado en ferias artesanales  y  se desplaza cada primer sábado de cada mes hasta Medellín para participar en la feria artesanal llamada San Alejo; feria muy famosa en la ciudad donde se reúnen en el Parque de Bolívar todos aquellos artesanos que ofrecen sus productos a los habitantes de Medellín y sus turistas.
El señor Gabriel desea comprar materia prima para continuar elaborando sus productos para poder atender la demanda de pedidos y ferias artesanales que se avecinan con la temporada de fin de año y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos para continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar y brindarle a sus tres hijas y esposa una mejor calidad de vida. A sus 48 años,  Don Gabriel desea construir su casa propia y darles todo lo necesario a sus hijas de 17, 16 y 13 años de edad quienes ven en su padre el mejor ejemplo a seguir.
texts.en:
On a sidewalk in the east of Antioquia department, in the town of El Carmen de Viboral which is noted for its great craftspeople, you will find the home of Gabriel who is a great expert in making and selling organic wood handicrafts and woven products together with his wife and one of his three daughters who are his greatest motivation and support.  Gabriel has carried out this beautiful work for 20 years, during which time he has participated in craft fairs and traveled on the first Saturday of every month to Medellín to take part in the San Alejo craft fair.  This is a very famous craft fair in the city.  All the craftspeople who sell their products to the inhabitants and tourists in Medellín gather there.

Gabriel would like to buy raw materials so that he can continue making his products and meet his demand for orders and craft fairs which are approaching with the end-of-year season.  In this way, he will increase his income and so be able to continue providing for his household and providing his three daughters and wife with a better quality of life.  At 48 years of age, Gabriel would like to build his own home and provide his daughters, who are 17, 16 and 13 years old, with everything they need.  The girls see their father as the best example to follow.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making his handicrafts

loans.name: Maria Eliberta

texts.es:
La señora Maria Eliberta tiene 53 años de edad,  esta soltera y vive con dos nietos, mismos que le ayudan con los que haceres de la casa, cuando Maria sale sus nietos le atienden el negocio, Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora  y se dedica a varias actividades como ser a la venta de hamacas, ropa usada, cuajada, plásticos y tiene pulpería en su casa, ahi vende abarrotería y refrescos, tambien durante los tiempos libres hace pan y rosquillas. 
Maria es cliente de PRISMA desde hace ya varios ciclos,  a trabajado en forma grupal y actualmente en forma individual, el credito lo utilizara para compra abarroteria y ropa interior.
texts.en:
Maria Eliberta is 53 years old. She is single and lives with two grandchildren, who help her with the household chores. When Maria goes out, her grandchildren cover for her in the business. Maria is a very hard-working woman, and she works at various activities, including selling hammocks, used clothes, cheese and plastic items. She also has a neighborhood store in her home. There, she sells grocery items and soft drinks. During her free time, she also makes bread and doughnuts. 

Maria has been a client with PRISMA for several loan cycles. She has worked on a group basis and is currently taking out an individual loan. She will use the funds from the loan to buy grocery items and undergarments.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for general maintenance for his motortaxi.

loans.name: Jose Ibrahan

texts.es:
Don Jose tiene una pulpería en su casa en donde es atendida por el y su esposa, tiene mas de 07 años de dedicarse al comercio, en donde vive es muy conocido por muchas personas, su amabilidad es especial y esto le ha ayudado a tener buena clientela, lo prefieren por ser amable al momento de atenderles y tambien por sus buenos precios, vive con su nuera y tres nietos, que estan estudiando, pero ellos no dependen de el, ya que su hijo les envía dinero de los ESTADOS UNIDOS para su manutención.
Don Jose es un buen cliente de prisma y comenzo de un grupo solidario, ya lleva tres créditos trabajando de forma individual y a demostrado fidelidad y puntualidad en sus pagos.
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en su pulpería, quiere surtirla, la época esta mejorando y las ventas igual.
texts.en:
Jose has a grocery store in his home in which both he and his wife work.  He has been working in commerce for more than 7 years.  Jose is very well-known in his area by a lot of people.  His kindness is special and this has helped him to attract good customers.  His customers prefer to buy from him because he is kind when he serves them and also offers them good prices.  Jose lives with his daughter-in-law and three grandchildren who are in school.  However, they are not dependent on him as his son sends money from the United States to provide for them.  

Jose is a good client of Prisma.  He started off working as part of a community bank but has now had three individual loans.  He has shown himself to be loyal and punctual in making his repayments.  Jose will use his loan to invest in his grocery store.  He would like to stock his store as the season is improving and so are his sales.

loans.use: to buy groceries, soft drinks and dairy products

loans.name: John Fredy

texts.es:
En su humilde casa ubicada al oriente de Medellín en el municipio de Marinilla, el señor John Fredy tiene su propio cultivo de frijol y pimentón. El señor John aprendió de su padre la labor de ser agricultor y desde hace mas de diez años todas las tardes luego de llegar de su trabajo alterno en un cultivo de flores, el señor John se dedica a las labores de la agricultura.
Debido a la ola invernal, el señor John necesita reforzar su cultivo con abonos y riegos que le permitan seguir creciendo y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y pequeños hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad.
A sus 30 años de edad y con la mentalidad emprendedora que lo caracteriza, John ve a su negocio con un futuro prospero que le permita generar empleos directos en su municipio.
texts.en:
At his humble home, located to the east of Medellín in the municipality of Marinilla, señor John Fredy has his own field where he grows beans and chili peppers. John learned farming from his father. For more than ten years he has worked in his field every afternoon after returning from his job at a flower farm.

Due to a cold spell, John needs to restore his field with fertilizers and irrigation that will permit him to continue raising his crops and in this way generate greater income and improve the quality of life for his wife and his two small children, ages 8 and 3. At 30 years of age with a characteristic enterprising attitude, John sees a prosperous future for his business which will allow him continuous employment in his community.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural resources such as fertilizer and irrigation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more antibiotics and medicines needed by his customers

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase the stock of his goods by buying items such as soaps, cans, sacks of sugar, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Foi Plus Group

texts.en:
Foi Plus is a community bank made up of 24 micro-entrepreneurs whose chairman is Yannick. These members are united for the same goal- to grow their businesses with loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

Yannick sells soft drinks in his area located in the eastern area of Kinshasa. He has been in the business world since 2010, selling the same product. After hard work and good management, he succeeded in making it thrive thanks to the accumulated profits. He is happy to be one of MFI HOPE’s clients. He intends to reinforce the capital with the next loan by adding some more crates of soft drinks. The business gives him a profit of 20 USD every day. 

Yannick’s ambition is to open a soft drink facility in his environment. He is 26 years old and single.

loans.use: to purchase 10 crates of soft drinks for resale at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase crates of drinks to resell at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase the stock of his goods by buying 10 charcoal sacks for resale at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
La señora Trinidad es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad y a quienes  les quiere dar lo mejor. 
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en comprar de ropa y zapatos de invierno para las ventas que tiene en diferentes partes de la ciudad. Aparte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio también se dedica a la venta de contratos de gas natura para las casas, con estos ingresos a sacado adelante a sus hijos. 
Desea mejorar su negocio y tener más variedad de mercancía para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Trinidad is a single mother with three children in her care. She would like to provide for them as best she can. 

She is requesting this loan to invest in buying winter clothing and shoes for the sales stands she has in different parts of the city. Apart from the earnings she obtains from this business, she also works selling natural gas contracts for homes. With these sources of income, she has been able to help her children get ahead. 
 
She wants to improve her business and have a greater variety of merchandise to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy used clothing as merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Nueva Asuncion Dist 4 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA ASUNCIÓN DIST. 4” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Elza. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura, tejido de mantas, tienda de abarrotes, alfombras, tejido de ponchillos.

La señora Elza,  indica que hace seis meses que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de sus amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo, aprendiendo el mismo de su esposo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de abarrotes) que adquirirá de la Ceja, por mayor, y posteriormente lo venderá en los puestos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio.
texts.en:
The “NUEVA ASUNCIÓN DIST. 4” community bank are about to start their first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office.  The group has seven members and is run by a board of directors which is led by Elza.  The businesses that the members of the bank are engaged in are varied and include: sewing, knitting blankets, running a grocery store, making rugs and knitting capes.

Elza says that she has been working with Pro Mujer for six months and she joined through an invitation from her friends.  She has a neighborhood store which she has been working in for some time.  She learned the business from her husband.

The loan that Elza is taking out will be used to increase her capital (buying groceries).  She will buy her products wholesale in La Ceja and will then sell them in her store.  This work allows her to make income with which to support her family.  Elza is married and has four children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Elza replied that she likes the medical clinic.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
La señora Rigoberta es casada tiene 33 años, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales 3 estudian, se dedica a la crianza D. animales, inició con el fin D. superar y lleva 8 años D. experiencia actualmente, espera en el futuro contar con capital amplio.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra D. animales consistente en pollos D. engorD.. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio, agropecuario, artesanía.
texts.en:
Rigoberta, 33, is married; she never went to school.  She has five children three of which are in school.  She raises animals.  She started out with the goal of improving herself and has 8 years’ experience to date; she hopes in future to have more capital.

She organizes a group to request a loan to buy chicks to raise.  The other group members are in commerce, animal husbandry and crafts making.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La señora Irene se dedica a la confección de polleras,  es de origen humilde, la señora es muy amable y respetuosa, vive en casa alquilada debido a que no genera grandes ingresos como para obtener un lote propio, tiene un hijo pequeño de 3 años y su esposo el señor Julián se dedica al transporte internacional, el señor se encuentra en Puerto Suarez, llevando así una cisterna, debido a que solo es chofer no genera buenos ingresos.
La señora Irene se dedica a la confección de polleras por mas de 5 años, ella confecciona dos docenas y media por semana de las cuales entrega los días de feria en la localidad de Sacaba como ser jueves y domingos, con el dinero del crédito comprara tela por rollo e hilos para la confección de polleras, ella es conocida por las comerciantes, debido a su responsabilidad a la hora de confeccionar y entregar las polleras, su deseo es tener un taller mas grande así confeccionar por cantidades y poder expandir su mercado a la ciudades de Cochabamba y Oruro.
texts.en:
Irene's business is making polleras (traditional skirts).  She is of humble origin and is very kind and respectful.  She lives in a rental house because she doesn't make enough income to buy a plot of land of her own.  She has a young son who is 3 years old and her husband, Julián, works in international transportation.  He is in Puerto Suarez and drives a tank truck.  As he is only a driver, he does not make good income.

Irene has been making polleras for more than 5 years.  She makes two and a half dozen every week and delivers them on market days in the town of Sacaba (Thursdays and Sundays).  She will use her loan money to buy fabric by the roll and threads for making polleras.  Irene is well known by the market traders owing to her responsibility in making and delivering her polleras.  Her wish is to have a larger workshop so that she can make her garments in larger quantities and expand her market to the cities of Cochabamba and Oruro.

loans.use: to buy fabric by the roll and threads for making polleras (traditional skirts)

loans.name: Gloria Nohelia

texts.es:
A sus 36 años de edad, Nohelia es una emprendedora que desde hace algunos años se dedica a la confección a terceros y actualmente genera 3 empleos a personas de Bello, municipio del Área Metropolitana de Medellín en donde vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. 

Nohelia inició con su negocio con la esperanza de mejorar sus ingresos y los de su familia y así tener una mejor calidad. En el futuro, esta emprendedora espera tener su propia línea de ropa y un local propio para trabajar. Por ahora necesita de un préstamo para comprar telas e insumos para producir mayor cantidad de productos y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
At 36 years old, Nohelia is an entrepreneur who for some years has worked creating for subcontractors and currently has 3 employees from Bello, the metropolitan area of Medellin where she lives with her husband and her two children.

Nohelia began her business with the hope of increasing the family income and thus to have a better quality of life. In the future, this entrepreneur hopes to have her own line of clothing and her own facility in order to work. Right now she needs a loan in order to buy fabric and supplies in order to make more products and thus increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fabric and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, a tortilla hotplate, firewood, milk, salt and other products

loans.name: Yhire Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “YHIRE” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Zenobia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, tejido de ropa de niños, venta de comidas, venta de productos de belleza, venta de juguetes, costura de enaguas, venta de condimentos.

La señora Zenobia,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de sus amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de heladera) que adquirirá de la Ceja, por mayor, y posteriormente lo implementara en su tienda para guardar y conservar los productos a vender. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The YHIRE communal bank will begin its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer with the Santiago II regional office. It is composed of eight members and has a board of directors headed by señora Zenobia. The members have various businesses including a neighborhood shop, making children’s clothing, selling meals, selling beauty products, selling toys, sewing petticoats, and selling spices.

Señora Zenobia says that this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer and that she established the communal bank at the invitation of her friends. Currently, she has a neighborhood shop which she has worked with for some time.

The loan she is applying for now is to purchase a refrigerator which she will acquire at wholesale in the community of La Ceja. She will install it in her shop to keep and preserve the products that she sells. Her business allows her to generate income to support her family. She is married and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responded that she likes the training in finance and health.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto es un luchador incansable que alterna su trabajo en el que maneja una retroescabadora con la venta de frutas y verduras en las diferentes calles de Bello, municipio en las afueras de Medellín en el que vive. Este emprendedor trabaja largas jornadas esperando mejorar su calidad de vida. Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar mayor variedad de frutas y verduras y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en: Luis Alberto is a tireless and hard worker who alternates his job running a steamroller with that of selling fruits and vegetables in the different streets of Bello, a town on the outskirts of Medellín where he lives. This entrepreneur works long workdays in hopes of improving his quality of life. Currently, he needs a loan to buy a greater variety of fruits and vegetables in order to increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nuevo Sendero Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Nuevo Sendero” está conformado por 20 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran preparación de comida rápida, venta de verduras, ropa y artículos de bazar. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.

Marcela integrante del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en segunda fila,ocupa el tercer lugar de derecha a izquierda, está sonrriendo, además viste una polera color lila y encima tiene puesto un chaleco color beige. Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente vendiendo ropa usada desde hace un año y medio, comenta que desde sus comienzos ha tenido muy buena recepción por parte de sus clientes.
Trabaja de lunes a viernes ofreciendo sus productos puerta a puerta o sus clientes se dirigen a su domicilio.
Mientras que los fines de semana vende, sus productos en ferias libres. 
Con el crédito comprará fardos de ropa para abastecer su negocio.
Sus metas, con plazo de dos años son instalarse en un local establecido, de esta manera ofrecer su mercadería de ropa en vitrinas. 
Marcela vive junto a su marido y su hija de 4 años de edad, uno de sus sueños a nivel personal son estudiar la carrera de obstetricia o podología. Para concretar este proyecto se inscribirá y matriculará a comienzos del año 2012. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio, además comenta del buen trato que ha recibido en la institución. Respecto al grupo del cual forma parte en el Banco comunal, comenta que es muy unido y responsable, por lo que se ha sentido muy cómoda. 
Por su parte las capacitaciones de emprendimiento, le han servido para distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos y también aprender a negociar. 
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Nuevo Sendero and is made up of 20 entrepreneurs who work in different areas such as the preparation of fast food and the sale of vegetables, clothing and variety items. All are from the city of Chillán.

Marcela is the member of the communal bank who is seen in the photo in the second row, third from the right. She is smiling and wearing a lilac colored shirt with a beige jacket. She has been a merchant, specifically selling used clothing, for a year and a half and says that since she started she has been well received by customers. She works from Monday to Friday selling her wares door to door or her customers come to her home. On weekends she sells her goods at street markets.

With the loan she will buy bundles of clothes for her business. Her goal is to set herself up in an established shop within two years so that she can showcase her clothing in display cases.

Marecela lives with her husband and 4 year old daughter. One of her personal dreams is to study obstetrics or podiatry. In order to make this dream a reality, she will enroll at the beginning of 2012.

She is very pleased and grateful for the opportunity to invest in her business that Fondo Esperanza has provided. As well, she speaks of the good treatment she has received from the association.  With respect to her membership in the communal bank, she notes that the group is very united and responsible and because of this, she has felt very comfortable. The leadership training sessions have helped her to better apportion her income and learn how to do business.  

Chillán is a township in the south central area of Chile. Its name means “silla del sol” (“chair of the sun”) in Mapudungun, the language of our indigenous Mapuches. Chillán is known as “Cuna de la Patria” (“Cradle of the Homeland”) or “Tierra de Artristas” (“Land of Artists”), because many figures prominent in Chilean history were born here, such as for example, the well-known pianist, Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothing to stock her business.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es: Gloria Isabel tiene 41 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora sus ganas de salir adelante le han ayuda con este negocio. Ella inicio por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar. El motivo del crédito que realiza es para la compra de calzados, perfumes, cremas, tratamientos, ropa interior, reloj y sabanas. Sueña con poder seguir adelante con este medio de vida.
texts.en: Gloria Isabel is 41 years old.  She sells general merchandise. She is a very enterprising person and her desire to get ahead has helped her with this business. She started it because she needed to meet her household expenses. The purpose of this loan is to buy footwear, perfume, creams, treatments, underwear, watches and sheets.

loans.use: to buy footwear, perfrume, creams, treatments, underwear, watches and bedsheets.

loans.name: Umbral De Triunfo Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Umbral de Triunfo” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de leña, repostería, feriantes, chocolatería, corte y confección, alimentos, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valdivia.
Elsa, presidenta del grupo del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un vestido estampado con colores Calipso, negro y blanco, encima lleva puesto un chaleco color beige, su cabello lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio y también presta servicios, se ocupa de estos dos negocios desde hace 24 años.
Prepara y vende productos de repostería entre kuchen y mote con huesillo (bebida refrescante chilena, sin alcohol), además presta servicios de banquetería para matrimonios, cumpleaños y otras festividades, ahí se encarga del coctel, platos de fondo, postres, torta y servicio de mesas.
La mercadería e ingredientes que va necesitando los compra en las ciudades de Temuco o Santiago. 
Con el crédito arreglará el carro con el que trabaja para ofrecer sus productos alimenticios. 
Las metas en su negocio son instalarse con un restaurante y una sala de eventos. 
Elsa vive junto a su marido y uno de sus sueños son ampliarse en su negocio.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo que participa, ya que son unidos, existe respeto y confianza. 
Valdivia es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Ríos. Se destaca por tener uno de los pocos ríos navegables de Chile, el Calle Calle. Valdivia presenta, dentro de sus principales actividades económicas, la industria de la construcción naval, maderera, papelera, celulosa (Celco), cervecera y molinera. El turismo desempeña un papel importante, como también los servicios educacionales universitarios, encabezados por la Universidad Austral de Chile.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Umbral de Triunfo [Threshold of Triumph] and is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who work in different fields, among which can be found the sale of firewood, pastry shop, people who make sales at the markets, chocolate merchants, sewing, food sales, and other services. All of them live in the city of Valdivia.

Elsa is the president of the communal bank. In the photo she can be found sitting in the first row, in the second place from right to left, wearing a print dress with Calypso colors, and black and white, wearing a beige jacket, and her hair is loose. 

She works in the field of commerce and also provides services and has been in these two businesses for 24 years.

She makes and sells pastries including tarts and mote con huesillo (Chilean soft drink without alcohol). She also provides catering services for weddings, birthdays and other holidays where there is a charge for cocktails, entrees, pastries, cakes and servicing the tables. 

She buys the supplies and ingredients that she will need in Temuco or Santiago. With the loan she will fix the car she uses for her work to provide her services. 

Her goals for the business are to establish a restaurant and an event room. She lives with her husband and one of her dreams is to expand her business.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that the Fondo Esperanza has given her to invest in her business. Also, she feels very comfortable with the group she is a member of. They are united, with respect and trust.
