Con este nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,200.00,  piensa comprar insumos para la preparación D. sus bocaditos, como harina, huevos, azúcar, leche, plátanos, maíz y frutas D. la estación para salir a venderlos.
Purificación es una mujer trabajadora, su sueño es tener un local donD. pueda vender refrigerio por las mañanas y comida al medio día, D. esa forma sus ingresos mejorarían.
texts.en:
Mrs. Purificación belongs to the "Alisson II" Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district, Lamas province, San Martin Department. She is 54, married, and has four children who all have families of their own.
She has always worked to generate an income and contribute to the household income.
Several years ago she opened a kiosk by the school near her home, selling refreshments. She did this for a few years until the school administration told her she had to stop, because they ran it. So, she decided to start making snacks such as pastries, plantain chips, and toasted corn. She sells these to the small kiosks located around the school, and in the afternoons she goes out to sell local fruits such as aguaje. This is how she gets ahead and generates her own income.
With this new loan of S/. 1,200, she plans to buy ingredients for making her snacks: for example, flour, eggs, sugar, milk, bananas, corn, and in-season fruit to sell.
Purificación is a hard-working woman. Her dream is to have a store from which to sell refreshments in the mornings and food at noon. This would proviD. her with a better income.

loans.use: to buy: flour, eggs, sugar, milk, bananas, corn and fruit.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
La Sra. Paola pertenece al Banco Comunal “Alisson  II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 27 años, está casada y tiene 01 hijo en edad escolar.

Desde pequeña ayudaba a su mamá con su negocio de venta de ropa, es así que fue creciendo, cuando formó su hogar se vió en la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio para generar sus ingresos y de esta manera contribuir con la economía de su hogar, y fue así, que con la ayuda del Movimiento Manuela Ramos y con un capital de S/. 500.00, logró hacer realidad este negocio, que poco a poco lo a ido implementando. 
Actualmente está acondicionado en su casa un ambiente para exhibir sus productos pues tiene una vitrina, lo que le permitirá captar a nuevos clientes, además siempre está en la búsqueda de novedades para dar más  opciones a sus clientes.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,300.00 comprará ropa para niños y adultos, y zapatos para implementar su negocio, algunos de ellos son pedidos de sus clientes.
Paola es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora,  su sueño es contar con un negocio más grande que le permita generar más ganancias.  Está muy contenta con el apoyo que le birnda el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Paola is a member of the 'Alisson II' community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in Lamas province, in San Martín department.  She is 27 years old, married, and has one school-age child.

Since she was a young girl, Paola helped her mom with her clothing business.  This is how she grew up.  When she formed her own home, she saw the need to start her own business in order to make income and thereby contribute towards her household finances.  With the help of Manuela Ramos and capital of 500 soles, she managed to start her own business and gradually fit it out.

Paola is currently setting up a space in her home in which to display her products in a display cabinet.  This will allow her to attract new customers.  She is always in search of new products so that she can provide her customers with more options.

With this new loan for 1,300 soles, Paola will buy children's and adults' clothes and shoes in order to stock her business.  Some of them are to fill orders that her customers have made.

Paola is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  Her dream is to have a larger business which will allow her to make more profits.  She is very happy with the support that she receives from Movimiento Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothes)

loans.name: Gisella Yaqueline

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen María se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Ciudad de clima cálido y con una variada  gastronomía.

Aquí conocimos a Gissella,  tiene 20 años y es soltera, estudia Ciencias para la Educación  en la Universidad de Montecristi. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos empezó su negocio el cual le permite ganar sus propios ingresos y con estos continuar con sus estudios para tener un mejor porvenir.

Ella además de estudiar también se dedica a la venta de de productos Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días y en sus horas libres de estudios ella les vende a  sus compañeras de clases y los fines de semana visita a otros clientes que tiene en la ciudad, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante bien, lo que más vende son los cosméticos ya que son muy buenos y variados.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y conseguir un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
The Virgen Maria ("Virgin Mary") communal bank meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi canton (Portoviejo). This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artisans, whose work is known nationally and internationally. The city's climate is warm and the gastronomy is varied.
Here we meet Gissella. She is 20, single, and studies educational sciences at the Universidad de Montecristi. She lives at home. 
Gissella has been a member of the communal bank for three cycles, and she likes it because she was able to use the loans to start her business. Her business allows her to make her own income, and with it continue her studies in order to have a better future.
On top of studying, she sells Esika products (beauty products; cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). She works every day, and when she doesn't have classes she sells her products to her classmates. On the weekends, she visits other clients in the city. She leaves her products on credit and charges every week. She has had this business for one year and it is going quite well. Her hottest products are the cosmetics, since they are very good and varied.
This loan is for the purchase of perfumes, creams, cosmetics and underwear.
Her dreams are to finish her studies and obtain a good job.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and underwear.

loans.name: Elizabeth Beatriz

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen María se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Ciudad de clima cálido y con una variada  gastronomía.

Aquí conocimos a Elizabeth, tiene 32 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, ella es licenciada en  auditoria.  Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido ayudar a sus padres.
 
Ella realiza trabajos contables en una empresa pequeña en la ciudad pero solo por medio tiempo ya que la otra parte de su tiempo la dedica al negocio que tiene en sociedad con su mamá, ellas tienen desde hace cuatro años un local en un lugar turístico donde llegan muchos turistas, allí venden artesanías propias de la zona como Hamacas, sombreros de paja toquilla, bisuterías, entre otras cosas, ellas trabajan todos los días y  siempre realizan buenas ventas ya que sus productos son muy apreciados por los turistas locales y extranjeros que llegan al lugar.
 
Este crédito es para comprar  bisuterías, hamacas, sombreros entre otras cosas para surtir más el negocio.
 
Sus sueños son crecer más en su negocio y conseguir un buen trabajo para ejercer la profesión.
texts.en:
The members of the "Virgen María" communal bank meet every two weeks in Montecristi canton (Portoviejo). This is a place  known for its rich pre-colonial culture, and for its handicrafts, which are recognized at the national and international level.  The city has a warm climate and a varied cuisine. Here we met Elizabeth, who is 32, single, and lives in her parents' house. She has a degree in auditing.

She has been in the communal bank for three loan cycles, and likes it, because through the loans, she has been able to help her parents. She does accounting work in a small company in the city; but only half time, as she devotes the other part of her time to the business she has in partnership with her mother.  

For four years they have had a shop in a popular tourist site. There they sell crafts characteristic of the area, such as hammocks, toquilla straw hats (also known as Panama hats), costume jewellery, and other things. They work every day, and always have good sales, as their products are highly prized by the local and foreign tourists who come there.

This loan is to buy costume jewellery. hammocks, hats, and other things to stock the business. Her dream is to see her business grow, and to get a good job, so she can practice her profession.

loans.use: To buy costume jewellery, hammocks, and hats.

loans.name: Santa Tomasa

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Virgen María se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Ciudad de clima cálido y con una variada  gastronomía.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Santa, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos, todos son mayores de edad, el último de ellos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus  clientes más conocidos. Trabaja todos los días, recorre la ciudad en las mañanas y en su casa el resto del día, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada ocho días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Manta y Portoviejo cada vez que necesita. Tiene 13 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde que empezó el Banco  y le gusta por los beneficios que ha recibido de parte de la institución. 

Su deseo es tener buena salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
The "Virgen María" communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton (Portoviejo). This is a place known for its rich pre-colonial culture, and for its crafts, which are recognized at the national and international level. It is a city with a warm climate, and a varied cuisine. 

This where we met Santa, who is 45, married, and has six children, all adults. The youngest of these still lives with her. Her husband is a shopkeeper. She has a business selling clothing of all types. She sells door-to-door, and also sells from her home, where her regular customers come.

She works every day, roaming the city in the mornings, and working from home the rest of the day.  She sells to her customers on credit, and collects once a week.  She goes to buy her merchandise in Manta and Portoviejo whenever she needs to.  She has been doing this work for 13 years, and it is going very well. She is going to use the loan to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing. 

She has been in the communal bank since it started. She likes it because of the benefits she has received from the institution.  Her wish is to have good health for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Eustaquio

texts.es: El señor Eustaquio, es originario de León, tiene 67 años de edad, padre de 7 hijos de los cuales dos de sus hijos los tiene estudiando en la escuela primaria, el es comerciante desde hace 20 años de edad vende ropa, zapato, cosméticos, productos de limpieza y aseo. Sus actividades inician desde tempranas horas de la mañana donde alista su humilde bolso cargándolo de mercadería para vender de casa en casa, entre buses y caminos polvorientos  sale a vender en lugares turísticos de la ciudad de León en busca del pan de cada día de manera digna y honrada, el vende su mercadería al contado y al crédito en lugares tales como Poneloya, LaCeiba, Las Peñitas que son los lugares donde mas vende antes de dedicarse al comercio el trabajaba en la agricultura. El solicita el préstamo para compra ropa, calzado y cosméticos para vender y lograr expandirse fueras de los lugares que actualmente vende. Uno de sus planes es expandir su s ventas a los municipios de Telica y Malpaisillo sobre todo aprovechar la temporada navideña.
texts.en:
Eustaquio is from León. He is 67, and the father of seven children. Two of his children are in primary school.  He has been a small businessman since he was 20, and sells clothing, shoes, cosmetics, as well as cleaning and hygiene products. 

He starts work in the early morning hours, when he gets his simple bag ready, loading it with merchandise to sell from door to door. Amidst the buses, and dusty roads, he goes out to sell at tourist sites in the city of León to earn his daily bread; decently and honestly.  

He sells his merchandise for cash and on credit in places such as Poneloya, La Ceiba, and Las Peñitas, where most of his sales are. Before working as a small businessman, he farmed. 

He is applying for the loan to buy clothing, shoes, and cosmetics to sell, and to expand his sales to places beyond those where he currently sells. One of his plans is to expand his sales to the municipalities of Telica and Malpaisillo; especially to take advantage of the Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes, and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, bottons, zippers and elastic.

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora Ana es socia del banco comunal Estrellitas, vive por el sector de Totoracocha en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene una mezcla entre lo colonia y la moderno, sus amplios paisajes naturales, la variedad en su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente quienes son cálidos y amables hacen de esta ciudad hermosa y muy hospitalaria.

Doña Ana tiene 46 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 27, 20 y 11 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja para sus gastos personales y su último hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión fotógrafo, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora Ana se dedica a la venta ambulantemente de limpiones de cocina, en esta actividad se encuentra hace 5 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en el treceavo crédito y lo va a  invertir en la compra de limpiones de cocina para temporada  de navidad.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the "Estrellitas" communal bank. She lives in the Totoracocha area of the city of Cuenca. This city is a mixture of the colonial and the modern, with vast natural landscapes. The variety of its cuisine captivates the palate of locals and visitors. Its people, who are warm and friendly, make this a beautiful and very hospitable city. 

Ana is 46, married, with three children, ages 27, 20 and 11, Her eldest daughter is married and lives independently. Her second child works in order to cover her personal expenses, and her youngest child goes to a small school in the city.  Her husband is a professional photographer. They don't have their own house, so they live in rented accommodation. 

Ana sells kitchen cloths in the street. She has done this for five years, and works from Sunday to Sunday with no fixed hours. 

She is on her 13th loan with the communal bank, and she is going to use it to buy kitchen cloths for the Christmas season. 

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy kitchen cloths.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 52 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is single and has four children between 23 and 28 years old. They are currently in school and live at home. 

For the past years she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) in the community. So she can make more profit and have more customers, she is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, coal, and oil for her business. She hopes to change her business to a bar and restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, coal, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy kitchen wipes.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La Señora Roxana, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo desde hace 21 años,  reside en  una Comunidad rural del Municipio de San Manuel, Cortes.
Ella tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solamente dos viven en su casa y están estudiando la educación secundaria.
La ocupación a que se dedica es la agricultura, produciendo plátano, guayaba y maíz con el apoyo directo de su esposo. 
Ha solicitado un préstamo para invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas para dar un mejor manejo a los cultivos.
En el futuro ella espera exportar el producto a varios países y aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Roxana, 33, has lived in a common law relationship with her husband since the age of 21.  She lives in a rural community in San Miguel Municipality, Cortes.  She has four children but only two still live at home; they are attending secondary school.

She is a farmer growing bananas, guavas and corn with direct help from her husband.  She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to provide better care for her plants.  In the future, she’d like to export her crops to various countries and increase her income to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 43 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is married and has three children between 20 to 25 years old. All of them are living on their own.

For the past five years she has been selling charcoal in the community. She makes more profit and has more customers, since she is the only one who sells charcoal in her community. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La señora Paula, tiene 55 años, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene un hijo soltero de 30 años de edad, reside en una comunidad del Municipio de Tela, Atlántida.
La actividad económica de Doña Paula es la elaboración de pan de coco el cual es elaborado a base de la leche del cocotero. El pan de coco es un producto tradicional propio de la cultura garífuna y es la base alimenticia de dicha etnia.
Ella comenzó su negocio a través de un grupo de mujeres que elaboraban pan para generación de ingresos, posteriormente el grupo se desintegro y ella decidió continuar con la producción y venta del producto en vista de que las ganancias que obtenía eran atractivas. 
Actualmente ella ha logrado la contratación de dos personas empleadas que le apoyan en la distribución del pan.
Dona Paula ha solicitado un préstamo para invertir en la compra de una estufa con horno grande e insumos como: cocos, harina, azúcar, margarina, además utensilios de cocina que le facilitaran la elaboración del producto. 
A futuro ella planea utilizar sus ganancias para ampliar su negocio y hacer mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Paula, 55, lives in a common law relationship with her husband.  She has a 30-year-old, single son.  She lives in a community in the Municipality of Tela, Atlántida.

Paula’s economic activity is baking ‘pan de coco’ bread which is made based on coconut milk.  The ‘pan de coco’ is a traditional product typical of the Garífuna culture and is this ethnic group’s main food staple.

She started this business through a group of women who baked bread to generate income.  Later, the group disbanded and she decided to continue producing and selling the product because the profits she obtained were attractive.  At present, she hires two people to help her distribute the bread.

Paula has requested a loan to buy a stove with a large oven and to buy supplies like coconuts, flour, sugar and margarine as well as kitchen utensils that will facilitate production.  In the future, she plans to use profits to expand the business and do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy a stove, supplies and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Nimia Lizett

texts.es: Nimia, de 41 años de edad, casada, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de Hot Dog y Hamburguesas, vive en la ciudad de León, madre de 2 hijos de 18y 20 años de edad, ambos están estudiando en la universidad. Ella inicio su negocio hace 7 años junto con su esposo ya que el tiene experiencia en el arte culinario ya que el  trabaja como ayudante de cocina le sugirió la idea de que pusieran este negocio. Actualmente tiene 2 carritos de puestos de Hot Dog y Hamburguesas ubicados en el parque de la ciudad de León  y el otro lo tiene en su casa de habitación. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar materia prima tales como pan, salsas, carne, lechugas, tomates para hacer sus tentadores hot dogs hamburguesas. Ella desea expandirse y comprar otros carritos de hot dog para poner mas puestos en diferentes puntos de la ciudad y ahorra para terminar de pagar los estudios a sus hijos y salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en: Nimia, age 41, is married and works as a merchant. She sells hot dogs and hamburgers, and lives in the city of Leon. She is the mother of two children ages 18 and 20. They are both in university. She started her business seven years ago with her husband, as he has experience in the culinary arts; he works as a kitchen aid, and it was his idea to open this business. They currently have two hot dog and hamburger stalls in the Leon city park, and another in their home. She needs this loan to buy basic ingredients such as bread, sauces, meat, lettuce and tomatoes to make her tempting hot dogs and hamburgers. Nimia wants to expand her business and buy more hot dog stalls in order to have more stalls at various locations in the city. She is saving up so that they can pay off their children's education and get ahead with their business.

loans.use: to buy basic materials such as bread, sauces, meat, lettuce and tomatoes.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years old and lives in Cabulihan, Larena, Siquijor. She is a widow with four children.

Jocelyn has a pig-raising business. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy feed and medicine for her pig business.

Jocelyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 6 months. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy feed and medicine for her pig-raising business

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 29 years old and lives in Tongo, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is married with four children.

To earn a living, Ailyn operates a snack-selling business. She earns approximately 1,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Ailyn requested a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her snack business.

Ailyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for 7 months. In the future, Ailyn would like to save money to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Paulita

texts.en:
Paulita is from Sto. Niño,Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is a married, 38-year-old woman with six children.

To make a living, Paulita operates a general store, where she sells a variety of food and everyday products such as candy, cigarettes, shampoo, and soap in her local community. Paulita has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 12,000 PHP per month from these activities.

Paulita is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. In 2010, Paulita joined GDMPC to gain much-needed access to financial services in order to help improve her business and to improve her family's standard of living. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Bandu

texts.en:
Bandu is 44 year old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and has six children between 12 and 28 years old.  All of them live at home and five are presently in  high school, while the oldest one is currently in college. 

For the past twenty years she has been selling fufu (a dumpling made from cassava) in the local market. Bandu says her business helps to sustain her children. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of fufu (African food made from cassava) for her business. She hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of fufu (African food made from cassava) for her business.

loans.name: Haydee Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña  Haydee de 58 años de edad, originaria de Leon, alegre y muy agradecida expresa su agradecimiento con los prestamistas de Kiva por apoyarla con su negocio de venta de libros y material religioso que ha sido de gran éxito para ella. Esta ocasión esta solicitando un tercer préstamo para comprar libros, poster, cuadro e invertir en ventas de tasas de café con imágenes de la virgen ya que se acerca diciembre que es el mes donde venden cuadros e imágenes de la virgen porque es el mes donde se celebra la Purísima una tradición religiosa propia de la ciudad de León, y sus clientes le hacen muchos pedidos y no quiere perder la oportunidad de dar a conocer sus productos seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en: Doña Haydee, age 58, is from Leon. She is happy and very grateful. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for supporting her business selling books and religious material. This business has been very successful. She is now requesting a third loan to buy books, posters, notebooks, and coffee cups with images of the Virgin; December is coming up. In December, they sell pictures and images of the Virgin because it is the month of celebration of the Purísima, a religious tradition belonging to the city of Leon. Her customers make a lot of orders, and she doesn't want to lose this opportunity to get her products out there and move ahead with her business.

loans.use: to buy books, prints, notebooks, and religious posters.

loans.name: Risa

texts.en:
Risa is married with 2 children.  Risa is 48 years old and lives in Helen Village, Larena, Siquijor.
To earn a living, Risa sells food as a vendor in the market.  She has had this business for 2 years.  Each month, she earns approximately PHP 2,000.00 a month. She has requested a loan of 5000 to buy assorted ingredients for food vending. Risa has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpsose Cooperative for one month.  
In the future, Risa hopes to have money for the future education of her children.

loans.use: To buy assorted ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
Erminda is 53-year-old married with two children and she's from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Erminda owns and operates a business venture, making and selling banana-cue food in the local community. She's been in this work for over 20 years and she earn 10,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Erminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erminda is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients needed in making banana-cue. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Erminda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed in making banana-cue (barbecued banana)

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is 44 years old and lives in Polangyuta, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She is married with 3 school age children.
Evelina has a retail business selling firewood for fuel and earns approximately PHP 4,000.00 each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to purchase firewood for resale.
Evelina has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Coooperative for 4 months.  In the future, Evelina hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase firewood for retail sale

loans.name: Fedelito

texts.en:
Fedelito is 41 years old, married with two children. He is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Fedelito has been operating his business venture for one year. He sells a variety of different products in the local community and he earn 7,000 PHP a month from this business. 

In 2011, Fedelito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fedelito is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Fedelito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha  is 24 years old and lives in the Paynesville area. She is single and has a four year old child who is in school and lives at home.  For the past three years she has been selling red oil (unrefined palm oil) in the market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business. She hopes to become an international business woman and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil (unrefined palm oil) for her business

loans.name: Nila

texts.en: Nila is 38 years old and lives in Sipaloc,Sibutad. She is married with three children.  To earn a living, Nila has a business selling grocery items. She earns about PHP 4000 each month doing this type of work. Nila has requested a loan to purchase additional stock to sell. Nila has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.

loans.use: To purchase 10 boxes of assorted groceries

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en: Estrella is 51 years old and lives in Sipalos, Sibutad. She is married with two children. Estrella has a hog raising business and earns approximately PHP 3700 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 14900 to purchase feed for her piglets. Estrella has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: To purchase 12 sacks of feed for her piglets

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is married and is 24 years old. She resides in Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. She has one child.

Mary Grace operates a fishing business selling seafood products including crabs, fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000.00 operating this business.

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000.00 which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Mary Grace has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Mary Grace wants to improve the general living conditions of her family and to save a monetary reserve for future emergencies

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Maria Joecylyn

texts.en:
Maria Joecylyn is 30 years old, married with three children and she's from Santo Nino, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Maria Joecylyn is running a general store selling a variety of food and home products in the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, and soaps, among others. She has been in this business for 1 year and she earn 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Maria Joecylyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Joecylyn is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Maria Joecylyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Santo Nino, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman with 2 children aged 9 and 11. She has had a sari-sari (convenience) store for 9 years. Elsa sells items like soft drinks, soap and shampoo to the people in her community. Elsa also sells rice cakes, ice candy and other local delicacies.

Elsa has requested a loan to purchase rice and other items to sell such as soft drinks and canned goods. Elsa hopes to grow her income and be able to save for her children's college education.

loans.use: to purchase rice and other items to sell such as soft drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Angela Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora es confeccionista, desde hace 5 años se lanzó como microempresaria, es propietaria de un taller de Costuras y tiene  44 años de edad. 
Tiene su taller en casa de sus padres, posee  máquinas industriales y un buen local con todas las comodidades necesarias para realizar su trabajo. Vive en la ciudad de Pilar,en el Barrio San Antonio, tiene casa propia,  y movilidad propia (vehículo).
Ella se dedica a la confección y ventas de prendas como: camisas, pantalon, remeras para damas. También fabrica uniformes para empresas por pedidos especiales. Tiene muy buena aceptación dentro del mercado, es conocida ya en la zona por su buena terminación en las prendas y precios acomodados. 
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad de pedir un préstamo, ya que sería invertido en compra de telas, que es la materia prima utilizada para la realización de su trabajo.
texts.en:
The member is a seamstress.  She started as a micro-entrepreneur five years ago.  She is the owner of a sewing shop and she is 44 years old.  Her shop is in her parents' house.  She has industrial machines and a good business with all the necessary conveniences to realize her work.  

She lives in the city of Pilar, in the San Antonio neighborhood, and has her own house and transportation (vehicle). She works making and selling articles of clothing such as shirts, pants, and t-shirts for women.  She also makes uniforms for businesses by special order.  She has very good success within the market; she is already known in the area for the good quality of her clothes and affordable prices.

She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity of requesting a loan.  She would invest it in buying fabric, the main material used to complete her work.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Dorina

texts.en:
Dorina is 36 years old. She is married with 6 children. Dorina is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. 

Dorina is operating a specialized retail store, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been in this business for three years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Dorina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Dorina is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional product to sell. This loan will be her tenth taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva works hard to support her family. Primitiva is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Primitiva has requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Primitiva has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future, Primitiva would like to save money for the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Blas Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Blas  de 46 años de edad, está casado con la señora Ramona de 49  años de edad, quien se dedica a la venta de hortalizas de su propia producción.
La pareja tiene seis hijos, tres varones y tres niñas, de los cuales la mayor es estudiante de Facultad, y el varón mayor de 18 años ya ayuda a su padre. Blas comenta que hace mas de 25 años se dedica a realizar trabajos de albañilería, construcción y plomería, de joven fue chofer, pero luego se lanzo a realizar obras de edificios, como vivienda, colocación de cerámicas, plomería y otros. 
Su cónyuge colabora con el cuidado de los hijos y de sacar adelante la producción de su huerta. Es admirable la actitud e interés del señor Blas por la educación de sus hijos, él busca recursos para llevar a cabo la educación superior de sus hijos, ya que están apartados de la ciudad y cuentan con pocos recursos.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad ofrecida y manifiesta que estaría destinando el capital para la compra de una mezcladora que le va a ayudar muchísimo para mejorar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr Blas, age 46, is married to Ramona, age 49. Ramona sells vegetables which she grows herself. They have six children, three boys and three girls. Their oldest daughter is in university, and their oldest son, age 18, helps his father.
Blas tells us that he has worked in brick laying, construction, and plumbing for over 25 years. When he was young, he was a driver, but he then decided to work on buildings; working on homes, installing pipes, plumbing, and other such things.
His wife helps take care of the children and works in their garden. Blas' interest in his children's education, and his attitude toward it, is admirable. He is trying to get the necessary resources to put his older children through higher education. They live outside of the city and have few resources.
Blas thanks the Fundacion Paraguaya for the opportunity they are offering and says that he will use this loan to buy a mixer. This will help him greatly to improve his work.

loans.use: to buy a mixer.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 44 years old, married, and has been blessed with four children. Her husband is a fishpond owner and a farmer. Her family is living within the local community of San Miguel Ramon. 

Carmen has run her variety store for eight years. She said that a nursing course is too expensive, but through her patience, faith in God and profit in her business, she is able to support her son until he finishes the course. 

She is really proud and thankful because her eldest is already working as a project officer. She is aiming for improvement of her variety store so that she could also send her other two children into higher levels of education just like what she did for her eldest child. 

She has been facing struggles nowadays because of their high household expenses. She would like to increase the income she generates from her business so that she could obtain her dreams in life. 

For this reason, she is asking for additional capital amounting to P10,000, allowing her to buy groceries such as soft drinks, breads, cooking oil, ingredients and sugar to restock her variety store. She is hoping that her requested loan will be granted, which will enable her dreams to be fulfilled.

loans.use: To buy groceries such as soft drinks, breads, cooking oil, ingredients and sugar to restock her variety store.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is a 56 year old married woman. She lives with her son and two daughters in Ho Chi Minh City. Thuy and her husband have been earning a living by running a food stall from the door of their home for the past ten years. They sell noodles.

Thuy is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying furniture and a good quality of food to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture and food to sell at her food stall

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 54 year old married woman. She has one son. She lives with her family in H. Chi Minh city. She has been running a general store for the past 5 years. 

Hoa would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of basic products to stock her general store

loans.name: Met

texts.en: Mrs. Met is the mother of 3 children. She lives in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She is now 51 years old and works in an agricultural business cultivating rice. In the past few weeks, her husband, a local farmer, got seriously ill and she doesn’t have enough money to pay for expensive medicine. She would like to ask for a generous loan from Kiva’s lenders to pay for her husband’s treatment. She is very grateful to have support for her family while she is in a difficult situation.

loans.use: to pay for her husband’s medical treatment.

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: María, de 33 años de edad, casada, tiene tres hijos pequeños de 16,13y 12 años de edad, están estudiando la secundaria , ella es comerciante , tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, su esposo trabaja en Costa Rica el cual le ayuda con las remesas que le manda mensual. Ella inicio su negocio con esfuerzos propios cuando ella se fue a trabajar a Costa Rica pero se tuvo que regresar porque no podía descuidar a sus hijos pero con lo poco que ahorro compro una refrigeradora empezó vendiendo helados de sabores, gaseosas a medida que su negocio fue creciendo fue invirtiendo en comprar otros tipos de productos tales como dulces, pan, productos de limpieza, sopas para vender la  ido muy bien. Hoy en día tiene 5 años con su pulpería que se ha ido levantando poco a poco. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, cosméticos, enlatados, pan. Estos son parte de los productos que no tiene y sus clientes buscan a diario y con la inversión podrá adquirirlos más fácilmente y así mejorar sus ventas, suplir necesidades de su zona. Ella esta muy enfocada en salir adelante con su negocio para que sus hijos tengan un mejor nivel de vida y tengan educación escolar. Una de sus expectativas es convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea.
texts.en:
María, 33, is married and has three young children, ages 16, 13, and 12.  They are in secondary school.  She is a merchant; she has a grocery store in her home.  Her husband works in Costa Rica, which helps her because of the monthly remittances he sends her.

She began her business with her own efforts when she went to Costa Rica to work, but she had to return because she couldn't neglect her children.  With her small savings she bought a refrigerator and began selling flavored ice cream and sodas, and as her business grew she invested in buying other types of products to sell, such as sweets, bread, cleaning products, and soup.  It has gone very well for her.  Today she has had her store for five years, and little by little she has gotten back on her feet.

She needs the loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, cosmetics, canned goods, and bread.  These are some of the products she doesn't have that her customers look for daily.  With the investment she will be able to get them more easily and so improve her sales and stock the necessities of her area.

María is very focused on getting ahead with her business so her children will have a better quality of life and an education.  One of her expectations is to convert her grocery store into a small general store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, cosmetics, canned goods, and bread.

loans.name: Khi

texts.en:
Khi is a 47 year old married woman. She has 3 children, one son and two daughters. She and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Khi earns a living running a general store which she has done for 10 years. Khi would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and candy, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enabL. her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income which will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enabL. her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and candy, to stock her general store

loans.name: Beinvinido

texts.en:
Bienvenido is 52 years old and lives in Lambojon, Siquijor, Siquijor.  He is married with four children. Bienvenido owns a general store to earn a living.  He earns approximately PHP 6,000.00 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase more stock for his general store.
Bienvenido has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Coopderative for one month.  In the future, Bienvinido would like to have savings for his childrens' future education.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his general store

loans.name: Lap

texts.en:
Lap is a 31 year old married man. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. They have 2 children. 

He and his wife earn a living running a general store, which they have done for 4 years. Lap would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods and beverages, to stock his general store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and increase the turnover of his business. He also hopes that through the loan his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and enable him to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods and beverages, to stock his general store

loans.name: Phung

texts.en:
Phung is a 43 year old married woman. She has two children, a son and a daughter. Her husband works as a carpenter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Phung has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop in the local community. Phung has been in business for five years. She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail-polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail-polish

loans.name: Erich Miguel

texts.es:
El joven estudiante Erich Miguel, de 20 años de edad, está cursando la carrera de Ciencias Contables y Administrativas, se halla en el primer año. 
Cuenta con el apoyo moral de sus padres, su madre es Docente, y muy dedicada a su familia, su padre es Contador Público Nacional. 
Erich, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación está logrando estudiar ya que trabaja de mañana y tarde, y como todo estudio superior universitario conlleva un costo elevado tanto con la matricula, los materiales didácticos y otros gastos.
Su mayor sueño es terminar su carrera y ser un buen profesional y lograr ingresar en alguna Empresa Pública como contador, su fiel ejemplo a seguir es su padre, se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya para solicitar apoyo mediante un crédito para solventar esos gastos.
texts.en:
The young student Erich Miguel, 20 years old, is in the first year of his program in Accounting and Administrative Sciences.  He enjoys the moral support of his parents.  His mother is a teacher and very dedicated to her family.  His father is a national public accountant.

Erich, with great effort and dedication is managing to study, since he works in the morning and the afternoon.  Like all advanced university study, it entails a high cost for tuition, learning materials, and other expenses.

His biggest dream is to finish his studies, be a good professional, and manage to become an accountant in some public enterprise.  His father is his exact example to follow.

He approached Fundación Paraguaya to ask for help through a loan to pay for those expenses.

loans.use: to pay for learning materials and for access to the library.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en:
Hiep is 52 years old and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has three daughters. For the past five years, she has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells women's garments. 

To help expand her business, Hiep would like to take a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. She hopes that this will help her to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for her family. Hiep hopes that in the future she will be able to improve the welfare of her children and continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Adiyapagma

texts.en:
Adiyapagma, 53 years old, lives with her husband and younger daughter in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor Province, Mongolia. Her husband is an electrician, while their elder two daughters are employed and their younger one is a college student. 

Adiyapagma started her grocery retail business in 2001 by renting a counter in the market, expanding over the years to include a wide range of products. Now that her children are older, Adiyapagma has more time to devote to the business, and so has rented  another counter in the market.  She is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more products for this second stall..

loans.use: to purchase more products for her business.

loans.name: Duong

texts.en:
Duong is 70 years old. He has three children: two sons and one daughter. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He earns a living running a general store, which he has done for 20 years. 

Duong would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods and beverages, to stock his general store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and increase the turnover of his business. He also hopes that through the loan, his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and enable him to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods and beverages, to stock his general store

loans.name: Hurelsuh

texts.en: Hurelsuh is 48 years old and lives with his wife in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and their kids are all employed and independent. He started his business in 2003 by retailing garments. However, since 2010 he started selling cart food, which is more profitable. It is more profitable,but, it is difficult to run it on a sunny hot day or blistering cold day. He sells his products by using his own car. He is lacking 2,800,000 MNT to buy grocery products from Erlian to sell in the rural area. He is a sharp and diligent man who says, "Now that my kids are old enough, it is time to concentrate on my business".

loans.use: To buy grocery products from Erlian to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a married woman having four school-aged and adult-aged children. Elisa is 47 years old, residing at Migpange, Bonifacio, Philippines. 

Elisa is operating a business selling seafood products including crabs, fish and shrimp in the local community to earn a living and she's been in the business for 18 years. Each month, she earns PHP 18,000 doing this type of business. 

Elisa requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Elisa has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Elisa wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Key

texts.en: Key, 29, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Key and her husband buy cows and pigs to resell. Key is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase more cows to resell, which will generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more cows to resell.

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en:
Jargalsaihan, a single mother of two, started her garment-retailing business in 2009 by renting a counter in market, selling very fashionable products. Her eldest child is employed, while the younger one is a college student. A sharp and hardworking woman, Jargalsaihan says, "Now that my daughter is a college student, she needs my support very much. I have to do everything I can in order to support her."

Her son is planning to operate a wool-selling business. Jargalsaihan is therefore requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to buy an electric saw for his new business.

loans.use: to buy an electric saw.

loans.name: Lieu

texts.en:
Lieu, a 38-year-old married mother of two, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. Lieu and her husband have been running a food stall for three years, selling noodles with beef.

Lieu is requesting a loan to expand her business through the purchase of more furniture and good quality foods. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture and good quality foods  for her food stall.

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Tuya is 49 years old and lives with her husband and three kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. Her husband is a driver and her oldest kid is employed. Her middle kid is a college student and the youngest one is a school student. 

Tuya started a traditional clothes-sewing business in 2000 by sewing at home. Now she has her own workshop and many regular customers. She says, "Now that winter is approaching, I need to buy some warm material in order to run my business." She is a sharp and hardworking woman and says, "I do everything I can in order to get my kids educated."  She is requesting 600,000 MNT to buy materials from Ulaanbaatar (the capital city of Mongolia).

loans.use: To buy material from Ulaanbaatar.

loans.name: Francia

texts.en:
Francia is 56 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 4 children.

To earn a living, Francia has a business selling a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about PHP2,000 each month doing this type of work. Francia has requested a loan of PHP12,000 to purchase ingredients. In the future, Francia would like to expand her business.

Francia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: for additional capital/buy ingredients

loans.name: Yermias

texts.en:
Yermias is a 42-year-old man married to Afliana, 39. They are blessed with four children: Alfalita, 14, who is attending Senior High School grade 1; Julio, 12, who is attending Elementary School grade 6; Novi, 8, who is attending Elementary School grade 2; and Rivan, who is 2 years old.
Yermias is a construction worker. He worked in an insurance company for ten years but the company went bankrupt. In order to meet his family's needs, he then started to work as a construction worker. Prior to his involvement in this business, Yermias gained some training in carpentry.
Yermias decided that he could not depend on his income as a construction worker because it was unstable. He therefore started another business selling pigs to generate more income. He has been running the business for years. He is now thinking of expanding the business by raising chickens. He would like to purchase two boxes of chicks and fodder. Therefore, Yermias is requesting a loan from Kiva partner TLM amounting to 3,000,000 IDR. He is hoping that his loan application will be approved by TLM soon.

loans.use: to purchase two boxes of chicks plus fodder.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is a 50 year old woman with 2 children, a son and a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Thu and her husband have been earning an income by selling rice and variety of basic goods from their general store, a business they started ten years ago.

Thu would like to take a loan to expand her current business by buying a greater variety and quantity of rice and basic goods to stock her general store. She is hoping that this will enable her to attract additional customers. Thu hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income, which would help improve her family's living conditions and enable her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of rice and basic goods to stock her general store.

loans.name: Amite Jane

texts.en:
Amite Jane is from Bocator, Tangub City, Philippines. She is 22 years old and married with three children. 

To make a living, Amite Jane owns a specialized retail store where she sells daily use products such as candy, sugar, shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. She has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately PHP 8,000 per month. 

Amite Jane joined GDMPC in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Amite Jane hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep is a 55-year-old married woman. Her husband works as a driver. They have two sons. Diep lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Diep earns an income by renting out rooms in her house. She would like a loan to upgrade the rooms to better accommodate her tenants. Diep hopes that this will help her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to upgrade the rooms she rents out.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun is a 38-year-old married woman who lives in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She works as a garment factory worker, earning a monthly salary of $80 for a living. She has a common law relationship with her husband, who works as a construction worker in and around the community. The couple has been married for a long time but unfortunately they are not blessed with any children at all. Bun strives to work overtime and she has saved some money to buy a motorcycle for the family's use. Due to lack of funds, she is taking out a loan from HKL and Kiva to add to her saved money to purchase a good motorcycle. Through this loan, the family will cut down on their daily transportation expenses. In the future, she dreams of having her own seamstress shop in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase a good motorcycle for daily transportation.

loans.name: Almagul

texts.en: Almagul is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-Ulgii Province, Mongolia. Her husband is a chauffeur, her elder child is a student, and her younger one goes to kindergarden. She started her cosmetic products retail business in 2010 by renting a counter in a market. Her business is going so well that she couldn't meet the customers' demand. Since the demand is high, she decided to rent another counter and buy even more products to sell. She is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more beauty products.

loans.use: To purchase more beauty products.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is a 41-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 2 children. She and her husband earn a living running a general store. 

Hang would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods such as cooking oil, eggs, snack foods, toiletries, and confections to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods such as cooking oil, eggs, snack foods, toiletries, and confections to stock her general store.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally, 47, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Phally sells food and her husband is a soldier. Phally is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to help her daughter run a beauty salon. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to help her daughter run a beauty salon.

loans.name: Fransisco

texts.en:
Fransisco is a 31-year-old man who is married to Yuliana, 30. They have two sons: Putra, 6, and Justin, 5, both of whom attend kindergarten. Fransisco also supports his nephew, Ady, 21, who is studying at a university. 
Fransisco owns a car rental business. He has been operating the business for almost one year. Through the business Fransisco is able to support his family's needs, his children’s education, and Ady as well.
Now Fransisco is seeking a loan of 4,000,000 IDR to repair his car. He is hoping that Kiva partner TLM is willing to help him with this business loan.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair his car.

loans.name: Tu

texts.en:
Tu is a 55-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 5 children. She and her husband earn a living running a general store, which they have done for 3 years.

Tu would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confections, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate more income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confections, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is married and has children. He is 38 years old and is residing at Migpange, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Felix is operating a fishing business, selling seafood products including crabs and shrimp, in the local community to earn a living. He has been five years in this business. Each month, he earns 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase additional crabs to sell and fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Felix has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Felix wants to save for future emergencies and to improve/expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs to sell and fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 52 years old. She lives in Sandugan, Larena, Siquijor. She is married and has nine adult children.

Luciana is a farmer and grows pigs to earn a living.  She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase feed and medicines for piggery.

Luciana has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for four months. Luciana hopes to expand and be able to sustain her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicines for piggery.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Yem, 40, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Yem sells fertilizer, and her husband is a taxi driver. Yem is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase medicine to cure animals for the farmers in her village. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy medicine to cure animals for the farmers in her village.

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en:
Quyen is a 53-year-old married woman. She has two children and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income by delivering newspapers. 

Quyen earns an income by selling ornamental fish. She has done this for the past two years. Quyen would like a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety and quantity of fish. She hopes this will enabL. her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of fish to sell.

loans.name: Do

texts.en:
Do is a 51-year-old married man. He has two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife earns a living selling clams. 

Do has been running a business of delivering fresh drinking water for eight years. He would like to take out a loan to buy a greater quantity of drinking water to expand his business and serve a greater number of customers. He hopes that through the loan, his business will generate a higher income and help him to improve his family's living conditions as well as enable him to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of drinking water to serve a greater number of customers.

loans.name: Sokna

texts.en: Sokna, 19, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Sokna sells vegetables, and her husband is a soldier. Sokna is requesting a loan of $750 to pay for a passport and the administration fee to work in South Korea. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to pay for a passport and the administration fee to work in South Korea.

loans.name: Ignasius

texts.en:
Ignasius, 36, is married to Judriani, 35. They are blessed with two children: Wendo, 10, who is studying at elementary school grade 5 and Merlyn, 8, who is studying at elementary school grade 3.
Ignasius runs a tire repair business and sells gasoline. He started the business 8 years ago by selling gasoline. As his income started to improve he then purchased a compressor and a billiard table. 
Ignasius also sells rice to generate extra income. He is planning to buy more rice for resale. Due to his limited capital, Ignasius is seeking a loan of  10,000,000 IDR from Kiva partner TLM. He will use the loan to buy rice in large quantities. He hopes that his loan application will be approved by TLM.

loans.use: to purchase rice in large quantities.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is a 55-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has six children. Her husband is a cobbler. Hue earns a living running a general store, which she has done for three years. 

Hue would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Se

texts.en:
Se, 41, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Se produces scarves to sell, and her husband is a farmer. 

Se is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached for her husband to provide transportation services. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike with a trailer attached for her husband to provide transportation services.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is a 41-year-old woman. She has one son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running a business selling second-hand clothing for 10 years. 

Hue would like to take loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen, 38, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Yen is a construction worker, and her husband is a soldier. 

Yen is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase a plot of farmland to expand her family farming business. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland to expand the family farming business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more meat to sell

loans.name: Saruul

texts.en:
Saruul is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.  Her husband is a production manager of a small factory and their two kids are school students. 

She started her beverage wholesale business in 2008 by renting a container in the market. Her business district's population is increasing rapidly, therefore she needs to sell a broad range of products and has to have more supplies in order keep up in the market. She is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to buy more juice.

loans.use: To buy more juice to sell

loans.name: Ma. Charina

texts.en:
Ma. Charina  is 42 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with eight children.
To earn a living, Ma. Charina  has a business selling viands. She earns about 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Ma. Charina has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her viand vending business.
Ma. Charina  has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC since 2011. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her viand vending business.

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en: Sopha, 34, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Sopha and her husband sell fish. She is requesting a loan of 750 USD to purchase a plot of land to build a house for her family. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to build a house.

loans.name: Yorhans

texts.en:
Yorhans is a 41-year-old widower. He is responsible for supporting and looking after his children (Ervan, seven, who is studying at kindergarten and Risky, five) since his wife passed away two months ago. 
Yorhans owns a kiosk business. He has been involved in this business for seven years; he sells a wide range of household products such as detergent, soap, dry bread, biscuits, sweets, shampoo, etc. 
Previously, Yorhans’s business ran well but when his wife became ill he could not run the business as usual. He had to look after his wife while she was hospitalized. The stock in his kiosk decreased and his income was spent on his wife's treatment and their daily needs. Since the death of his wife, Yorhans thinks that he has to continue his life as his two adorable children still need his love. He intends to add more stock to his business and to purchase chicks to raise and fodder, but he needs money to do so. 
By chance, Yorhans met a TLM field officer and got information on TLM’s individual lending program. He is interested in joining the program and has requested a loan of 6,000,000 IDR. Yorhans really hopes that TLM will approve the application.

loans.use: to purchase more kiosk stock, chicks to raise and fodder.

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is business oriented because she is able to improve her retail store. She is 28 years of age, married, and has two children. She has been selling different kinds of daily needs, soft drinks and other items needed within the local community of San Miguel Ramon. 

Monaliza has operated her retail store for one year, while also vending frozen foods for three years. According to her, she is able to sell 500 pieces of skinless longanisa (native Filipino sausage) and 200 pieces of tocino (sweetened cured pork) weekly. She would like to buy more stock of groceries and frozen foods, but her profit is not enough due to their household expenditures and school allowances for her children. 

She is asking for financial assistance in the amount of P20,000. She hopes that she can get the amount requested, allowing her to maintain and develop her retailing business. In this way, she could generate bigger income to improve their living conditions and support her two children in their studies.

loans.use: to purchase stock groceries and frozen foods for her retail business.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a humble farmer from Roma Norte Enrile in the province of Cagayan. He is married to a housewife, and Jose is now 42 years of age. They were blessed with two children whom he sends to school. He owns a hectare plot of land which he plants and cultivates with rice to merchandise. This is Jose's primary source of income. He usually acquires a net income of P20,000 each harvest season, during the months of April and November.

Now, Jose is borrowing a loan amount of P12,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides in order to maintain good crops from his farm. In the future, he aims to alleviate his family from poverty.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Narangerel is 34 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business, her elder two children are school students and her youngest child goes to kindergarden. 
Narangerel started her business in 2009 by selling firewood and coal from home. She then built her own small shop to sell it. Now that winter is approaching, demand for her product is very high. Therefore she needs some financial support to meet her customers' demands. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "My business is the only income for the family and I have three children to support therefore I have to do everything I can to support them". She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy more wood.

loans.use: to buy more wood for resale.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 43 years old and lives in Migpange, Bonifacio, Philippines. She is a married woman with two children. 
Tita has a business venture selling seafood products, including crabs and shrimp, in the local community to earn a living. She has been working in this business for 16 years. Each month, she earns 4,400 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to pay for harvesting crabs. 
Tita has been a member of Kiva partner GDMPC for a year. In the future, she wants to build house, see her children finish their studies, and save a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting crabs.

loans.name: Saulegul

texts.en: Saulegul is 40 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-Ulgii, Mongolia. Her husband is a construction worker and her children are all school students. She started her sewing business in 2006 by sewing wallets. Now she sews all kinds of bags, wall hangings and pillow cases. Her sewn products are very stylish and her embroidery is beautiful. Now that demand for her sewing services is increasing, she needs to buy more raw materials. She is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy materials and a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Quan

texts.en:
Quan is 29 years old. She has one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn a living by selling clothes and materials, which they have done for the past two years. 

Quan would like to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell to people in her community. She hopes that through the loan her business will expand and her income will increase. This will enable her to set aside savings for her daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tuul

texts.en: Tuul is 32 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife babysits her youngest daughter at home and the other two children are school students. Tuul operates a clothes-selling business. He started his business earlier this year by buying a 20-foot container at the market. His business is doing very well. Now that winter is approaching, he needs warmer clothes to sell. He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy winter clothes. Tuul is a sharp and diligent man who says, "Even though I'm fairly new to the business, the income is fairly good and I have a mission to build my own store one day."

loans.use: to buy winter clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand, age 56, is a rice farmer. He and his wife have a rice field that serves as their primary source of income. His wife also engages in a hog-raising business to earn extra income. They work hard to lift their four children from their poor standard of living. The family lives in the village of Nagrumbuan, Cauayan City, Isabela.

Ferdinand is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy farm inputs such as seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides to sustain his farm. He hopes that he can receive the amount he has requested to further grow his farm and harvest more rice to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides to sustain his farm

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
This is Nilda, age 58, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Magdalino, a driver. She is a mother of one child. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
