Nilda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small quantity of cooking oil or an egg. She earns a living by buying supplies at wholesale prices and then selling them. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nilda dreams of being able to give all her family a good future through her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is from Mantic Tangub City. She is 50 years old. Leonila is married and has three children. 

To earn a living, Leonila operates a retail business, selling a variety of personal products in the local community such as shorts, blouses, accessories, etc. Leonila has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Leonila is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. In 2010, Leonila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: Tan

texts.en:
Tan is a 38-year-old woman. Her husband works as a carpenter. They have two daughters and live together in H. Chi Minh City. Tan earns an income by making clothing. She has done this for eight years. 

Tan would like to take out a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine, sewing tools, and fabrics. This will increase her productive capacity and allow her to create a larger amount of clothing. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and set aside some savings for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine, sewing tools and fabrics

loans.name: Oyshamo

texts.ru: Ойшамо проживает городе Кургантюбе. Ей 42 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж находится в России. Сама она занимается скотоводством.  В основном она откармливает и продает крупнорогатый скот. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Oyshamo lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 42 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband is in Russia. She herself works in animal husbandry. She primarily fattens and sells cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: purchase calves

loans.name: Hureltulga

texts.en: Hureltulga is 27 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (a Mongolian yurt/ nomadic tent) in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and his son goes to kindergarten. Hureltulga operates a photography studio. He started his business in 2009. He is very talented for a local photographer, however, his camera is broken, therefore he needs to buy a replacement part. He is a talented young man who says "It has been horrible since my camera got broken and I have to do everything I can to fix this". He is requesting 800,000 MNT to repair some other piece of his reducer machine - copy machine that alters the size of pictures, which is broken.

loans.use: To repair a piece of his reducer copy machine

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Phat is 38 years old and single. She lives in H. Chi Minh City. She earns an income by selling mobile cards and SIM cards. She would like to take out a loan to buy a greater quantity and range of SIM cards and mobile cards to serve more people. She hopes that the loan can help her to improve her income and her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and range of SIM cards and mobile cards

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
This is Angela, 51, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Quintelo, a tricycle driver, and a father of her six children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to cover her everyday expenses.  

Angela operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Angela dreams to be able to give her whole family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Cristo Y Nuestro Esfuerzo 4 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Marie is the coordinator of her group, Cristo Y Nuestro Esfuerzo 4 & 7 (Christ and Our Effort). She is a young woman who is just 26 years old. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her parents. She says that her most difficult challenge is to recover her profits after she sells on credit. In the meantime, she plans to continue working and studying. 

Marie is excited to be taking out a third loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for two years, starting out with her own savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying some bags of used clothes and different miscellaneous products, like shoes, cosmetics and others. She is planning to use her business profits to become a professional and to help her family.

Marie´s group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. She thanks all of you for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy bags of used clothing and miscellaneous products

loans.name: Rubylyn

texts.en:
This is Rubylyn, who is 34 and a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Leonardo, who is a factory worker, and she is the mother of her four children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rubylyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippines pesos (Php) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rubylyn dreams to be able to give all her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc is a 51-year-old woman. She has one son and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Ngoc and her husband have been earning a living by running a food stall and a general store for 11 years. 

Ngoc is asking for a loan to buy a range of basic goods such as rice, soft drinks, milk and sugar to stock her general store and sell from her food stall. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy a range of basic goods such as rice, soft drinks, milk and sugar to stock her general store and sell from her food stall.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is 37 years old and lives in Misom, Baliangao. She is married with four children. 

Charlotte has a shop that sells ready-to-wear clothing and jewelry items. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase ready-to-wear items and jewelry to sell.

Charlotte has been a member of PMPC for 11 years.

loans.use: To purchase ready-to-wear items and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Saveoun

texts.en:
Saveoun, 38, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Saveoun is a farmer, and her husband sells rice. 

Saveoun is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a horse and rice to resell. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a horse and rice to resell

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is a 41-year-old woman. She lives with her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income by trading in fish sauce. Dung has been running a coffee shop for 14 years. 

Dung would like to take a loan to buy plates, furniture, coffee and beverages to expand her business. She hopes that this will enabL. her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy plates, furniture, coffee and beverages to expand her business.

loans.name: Izomat

texts.ru: Изомат 46 лет, она замужем и мать 5 детей. Более 11 лет она занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания. В бизнесе ей помогает дочка. Она начала свой бизнес с купли продажи мелочевки, а потом постепенно перешла на продажу продуктов питания. Особенности бизнеса в том, что лавка находится в центре города в многолюдном месте. С целью получения прибыли, она хочет расширить ассортимент продуктов питания, чтобы осуществить все свои планы и желания, она запрашивает займ в размере 5000 Сомони.
texts.en: Izomat is 46 years old, married with five children. She has been in grocery sales for over 11 years. Her daughter helps her. She started her business with the purchase and sale of consumer goods, and then gradually moved to the sale of food. Her shop is located in a crowded, downtown area. She wants to expand her product line in order to increase her profit and accomplish her goals. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni.

loans.use: Purchase goods to expand product line

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is a 42-year-old married woman. She has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Ha's husband has been working as a carpenter. Ha has been running a food stall by her door for 10 years. She sells noodles. 

Ha would like to take a loan to buy furniture and dishes to expand her business. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy furniture and dishes to expand her business.

loans.name: Ismoiljon

texts.ru: Исмоилжон 39 – летний женатый мужчина. У него трое детей. Исмоилжон таксист, он развозит людей по маршруту Бохтар – Кургантюбе и обратно. Его сын тоже предоставляет услугу, такси. Исмоилжон берет кредит для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Ismoiljon is 39 year old married man. He has three children. Ismoiljon is a taxi driver; he drives people on the Bohtar-Qurgan-Tube route and back. His son also provides taxi services. Ismoiljon is requesting a loan to fix the cars.

loans.use: fix the cars.

loans.name: Khai

texts.en:
Khai is a 59-year-old married woman with two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.
Khai and her husband have been running a general store for 20 years. She would like to request a loan to buy many kinds of goods, such as soft drinks, biscuits, jam, and tea to stock in her store. She hopes that the loan will enable her to generate a higher income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of goods, such as soft drinks, biscuits, jam, and tea for her store.

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel is 37 years old and is married with two children. He has been energetically farming in the village where they are living for over 15 years. His farm produces almost 25,000 PHP with every cropping. His wife also sells vegetable for their additional income. They both work hard to give their children a good quality of life. 

Now he has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI to buy seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides for his rice field. Ariel hopes to grow his business and harvest more rice to sell. He expects major changes in his family’s living standards. He appreciates ASKI and Kiva lenders services and is looking forward to a long-term relationship with them.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizers and insecticides for his rice field

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang is a 48-year-old married woman with four children – two sons and two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns a living by working as a driver. 
Hang has been running a general store for ten years. She would like to request a loan to buy many kinds of goods, such as soft drinks, sugar, and beans to stock in her store. She hopes this loan will enable her to generate a higher income to improve her family's living conditions and give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of goods, such as soft drinks, sugar, and beans to stock in her store.

loans.name: Phard

texts.en: Phard, 57, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Phard and her husband are farmers. Phard is requesting a loan of USD 550 to purchase more blacksmith equipment for her son to expand his business. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy blacksmith equipment for her son to expand his business.

loans.name: Baktybek

texts.ru:
Бактыбек родом из села Кум-Арык (Панфиловский район, Чуйская область, Кыргызстан). 
Бактыбек родился в 1980 году в простой семье фермера.  С детства Бактыбек, будучи старшим братом двух сестренок, помогал отцу по уходу за скотом и мечтал в будущем иметь свое собственное хозяйство. После окончания школы, Бактыбек пошел учиться в автодорожный техникум на водителя сельхоз техники, а затем устроился в местный колхоз  в качестве тракториста - комбайнера. Спустя год у Бактыбека, в результате болезни, умирает отец. Эти были тяжелые времена для него, так как он стал единственным мужчиной и кормильцем  в семье, мать нигде не работала, сестренки были еще маленькими. Проработав в колхозе несколько лет, Бактыбек решил уехать за границу на заработки. За несколько лет он проработал в Алмате (Казахстан) и Москве (Россия), в качестве охранника, водителя, строителя и других профессий, не требующих соответствующего образования. Бактыбек отправлял заработанные деньги домой, на которые мать покупала скот и выдала замуж дочерей.
В 2010 году Бактыбек решил жениться. В этом же году у него случилось несчастье - умерла мама. Эту утрату ему помогла пережить его жена, которая стала его опорой во всем.   Бактыбек твердо решил заняться животноводством  и на данный момент, благодаря упорству Бактыбека, в хозяйстве у него насчитывается 2 дойных коровы, 2 бычка и 30 голов баранов. Ежемесячная прибыль от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет около 10,000 сом.  В целях дальнейшего увеличения, Бактыбек обратился в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры»  за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров.  В дальнейшем Бактыбек планирует увеличение поголовья скота и мечтает построить большой дом.
texts.en: Baktybek is a native of the Kum Aryk village (Panfilovsky region, Chuyskaya oblast, Kyrgyzstan). Baktybek was born in 1980 to a simple farming family. From childhood Baktybek, the older brother of two sisters, helped his father care for the animals and dreamed of having his own farm in the future. After high school, Baktybek studied at an automotive technical college to be an agricultural equipment driver, and then settled down at a local farm as a tractor-combine operator. A year later, Baktybek's father died of an illness. This was a difficult time for him, as he became the only man and provider for the family; his mother did not work anywhere and his sisters were still young. Having worked on the farm for several years, Baktybek decided to go abroad for work. For a few years, he worked in Almaty (Kazahstan) and in Moscow (Russia) as a security guard, driver, construction worker and other jobs that did not require an education. Baktybek sent his earnings home and his mother bought cattle and got her daughters married. In 2010, Baktybek decided to get married. In this year something unfortunate happened- his mother died. His wife helped him survive this loss, who became his support in everything. Baktybek resolutely decided to raise livestock and at this time, thanks to his perseverance, Baktybek  has 2 dairy cows, two bulls and 30 heads of sheep. His monthly income from selling milk and dairy products is around 10,000 som. In order to further increase this amount, Baktybek has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners to request a loan of 100,000 som to buy dairy cows. Later Batybek plans to increase his amount of livestock and dreams of building a big home.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Nun

texts.en: Nun, 47, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Nun is a farmer, and her husband is a construction worker. Nun is requesting a loan of USD 900 to purchase more piglets to raise for sale. By doing so, her family will be able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise for sale.

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en: Rorn, 47, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Rorn is employed at a factory, and her husband sells palm products. Rorn is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase groceries to sell in front of her house. By doing so, her family will able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Muhamadkarim

texts.ru: Мухамадкарим житель города Худжанд. Ему 50 лет. У него трое детей. Он занимается животноводством. Этот вид деятельности у них является семейным. Мухамадкарим уже шесть лет занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота у себя дома. Он берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Muhamadkarim lives in the city of Khujand. He's fifty years old and he has three children. Muhamadkarim breeds animals for a living. It's a family business that he has been involved for the past six years. 
He's asking for a loan in order to purchase some large cattle and increase his herd.

loans.use: to purchase large cattle.

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en: Batbaatar is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Govi-Altai Province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business, and their two kids are in school. He started his raw materials (wool and cashmere) business in 2007. He travels across the countryside to get his products. His business is in pretty much the same place where he started due to financial challenges. He wants to expand his business by buying more products. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I have plenty of opportunities to expand my business; however, I have always limited resources." He is requesting 1,200,000 MNT to buy 40 lambs and goat kids.

loans.use: To buy 40 lambs and goat kids.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally, 34, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Phally sells pigs, and her husband sells rice. Phally is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a plot of farmland and more rice to resell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland and more rice to resell.

loans.name: Odonbayar

texts.en: Odonbayar is 23 years old and lives with his parents in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Govi-Altai province in Mongolia. His parents are retired. He started his business journey by operating a taxi service in 2005 using his own car. Then in 2007 he rented a counter in the market to run a dairy and meat retail business. Since then his income has been pretty much the same, so he decided to expand his business by renting another counter in the market. However he lacks resources to run his business, so he's requesting 3,500,000 MNT to buy 3 cows and dairy products. He is a sharp and diligent man who says, "It's been a while since I started my business. It's time to move aggressively and expand my business."

loans.use: To buy 3 cows and dairy products.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman and lives in San Miguel Ramon with her spouse and four children. Of her four children, one of them has settled into marriage and lives separately from them.

Emma has been operating her small store for three years. She has been doing this to earn an income to provide her family's needs. Aside from her retailing business, she is also engaged in a hog raising business to earn additional income. 

One of Emma's marketing strategies nowadays is to offer the merchandise needed within their village to encourage more costumers to buy her products. So, Emma is asking for a loan amount of 15,000 PHP to stock more grocery items in her variety store. In this way, her sales and profit will also increase.

Emma is hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life and earn greater profits. Emma believes that through her determination and patience she could be a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy stock grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра портниха. Она занимается шитьем. Ей 32 года. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Гулчехра принимает заказы на дому. Она десять лет занимается этим видом деятельности. Кредит берет для приобретения швейной машинки с компьютерным управлением для пошива и вышивки платьев.
texts.en:
Gulchehra is a tailor by trade. She's thirty-two years old, married and has three children. 
Gulchehra has worked as a tailor from home for the past ten years. She is asking for a loan in order to buy a computerized sewing machine used for tailoring and embroidering dresses.

loans.use: to purchase a computerized sewing machine.

loans.name: Krubo

texts.en: Krubo is 23 years old and lives in Paynesville. She’s married and they have a three-year-old child who lives at home. For the past ten years, Krubo has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) in the local market. She makes a lot of profit that will help her to send her children to school. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, pepper and coal for her business. She hopes to build a house and send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper and coal for her business.

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbat, 54, is a railwayman. He has been doing his job for 38 years non-stop and lives with his wife and 2 sons in Kherlen, a western boundary town in Mongolia.  His family owns an old house which was built in the early 1980s. Lately his house has become very old and is damaged in many places. Generally, since it was built, no repairs or renovations have been made to it. 

According his plan, he will make repairs to the inside of the house before next spring. Therefore, Ganbat is taking a loan to purchase some necessary building materials to renovate his old house.

loans.use: To purchase some necessary building materials to renovate his old house.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is from Silanga, Tangub City. She is 40 years old. She is married and has four children. 

To make a living, Melba is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community such as sardines, candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps, etc. She has been in her business for 8 years and earns about 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Melba is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. In 2010, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Olival

texts.en: Olivial is 40 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and they have three children between 10 and 17 years old who are in school and live at home. For the past ten years she has been selling dry coconuts in the local market. She makes lots of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry coconuts for her business. She plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more dry coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Gansukh

texts.en:
Mr. Gansukh, 44, is a taxi driver around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He lives with his wife and his 3 kids on the boundary side of the city. He has been running his business since 1999, but not earning enough to provide for all of his family expenses.
 
His family owns an old house which was built in the early 1990s. Since it was built, no repairs or renovations have been made to it. Lately his house has became very old and damaged in many places. Especially, all of the windows have broken in the last several years. Therefore, it loses the heat to the outside through the windows. Due to this, his home becomes very cold during the winter time.   

Gansukh is taking a loan to purchase new windows to replace the old ones in his house.

loans.use: To purchase new windows to replace the old ones in his house.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 48-year-old married woman with four children who are enrolled in school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Veronica has operated a fruit selling business for the past four years, and her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces the major challenge of competition from other operators. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase more fruits and maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial facilities to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and maize for resale.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila is 42 years old and lives in Ibabao, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She is married with three children. Mila has a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years.  Each month, she earns about PHP 1,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan to use for capital in her grocery store. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for one month.  In the future, Mila hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en: Gleceria is 57 years old and lives in Gotocan Daku, Osamiz City. She is married with five children. Gleceria is a farmer and she raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan of P 14,999 to purchase more pigs. She has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs.

loans.name: Munhktsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhtsetseg, 36, runs a rental grocery store. Actually she sells the beverages such as a vodkas and beers.  She has been doing her business since last year, and she has enough experience to run this kind of business because she used to work as a seller in her friend’s store.
 
Lately she needs to increase her store's working capital substantially, because her income has decreased in the last several months due to having less working capital. Therefore she is taking a loan to purchase beverage commodities such as some kinds of vodkas and beers for increasing her store's working capital.

loans.use: To purchase beverage commodities, such as some kinds of vodkas and beers for increasing her store's working capital.

loans.name: Umedchon

texts.ru: Умедчон житель города Истаравшан. Ему 29 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена занимается шитьем. Умедчон таксист. Он занимается развозкой людей по городу а также иногда он возит пассажиров по маршруту Истаравшан – Душанбе. Умедчон берет кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en: Umedchon is a resident of the city of Istaravshan.  He is 29 years old, married and has two children.  His wife is involved in sewing.  Umedchon is a taxi driver.  He is involved in transporting people within the city and sometimes drives passengers along the Istaravshan - Dushanbe route.  Umedchon is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car, so that he can provide a safe service.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Vivencio

texts.en:
Vivencio is proud that he is a farmer. He is married and has one child. Vivencio's wife is a store owner. He is glad because his wife is supportive in improving their living conditions. 

Vivencio has owned and managed his three hectares of rice fields for almost 17 years. According to him, he is experiencing hardships in maintaining his farmland due to the disastrous effect of typhoons Pedring and Quiel last October. In this situation, he is asking for additional capital in the amount of 30,000 PHP to allow him to buy his farm inputs such as fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, certified seeds, and for payment of labor costs of transplanting and sowing rice fields.

He is hoping for approval of his requested loan amount to be able to improve his farmland and increase his yields this coming crop season so that he could get greater income. Through this income generated from his farming business, he could educate his only child and improve the standard way of their living.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, certified seeds, and for payment of  labor costs of transplanting and sowing rice fields

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is from the village of Mantic, Tangub City. She is 53 years old. Marilou is widowed and has 5 adult children. To make a living, she raises and sells pigs. She has been in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2008, Marilou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions and for daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Nzuve

texts.en:
Nzuve is a 43-year-old married man with three children, all of whom attend school. His wife Prisila is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children. 

Nzuve has operated a retail shop for the past six years; his potential clients are the local area villagers. He faces the major challenge of customers not paying their debts on time. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase a motorbike for his new transportation business. He decided to join Yehu because of the easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his new transportation business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman with four children who are enrolled in school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Victoria has operated a café for the past six years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and beans for her cafe. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and beans for her cafe.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Sophea is a 40-year-old widowed mother living in the rural area of Tbaung Khmum district, and she has five children. She is a farmer and also she plants cassava to generate additional income to support her family. To earn a living, Sophea has been with this business for 15 years. This is her first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy a plot of land for her cassava plantation. With this loan, she hopes to grow more cassava and also earn more income to better feed her family and build on some necessary household assets.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land for her cassava plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Rona

texts.en: Rona is married with one child. She is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan of PHP12,500 to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sacks of feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tupee

texts.en: Tupee is 30 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have two children between 10 and 20 years old, who are in school and live at home. For the past two years she has been selling charcoal in her community. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to attend college.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
With his desire to improve his family's living situation, Ronald has devoted himself full-time to his rice farm business for 15 years. He is 33 years old and is married to Joana, who also sells vegetables in the local community for their additional income. They work hard to give their three children a good quality of life and to lift them out of poverty.

Now he is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his rice farm business. He hopes to grow and increase his yield with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his rice farm business

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a married woman with five children. She is 34 years old and resides in Mantic, Tangub City, in the Philippines. Vicenta owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living, and she's been 3 years in this business. Each month, she earns about PHP 4,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase products to resell. Vicenta has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, she wants to improve her business and to finish the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mali

texts.en:
Mali is a widowed woman with seven children who are enrolled in school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mali has operated a retail shop for the past year, and her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Garmah

texts.en: Garmah is 52 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is married and her husband is a social worker. They have four children between 15 and 27 years old, all of whom are in school and live at home. For the past four years she has been selling rice, oil and pepper in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, pepper, and rice for her business. She hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, and rice for her business.

loans.name: Bibituydigul

texts.ru: Бибитуйдигул 45 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Бибитуйдигул занимается торговлей мужской одежды на рынке. В этой области он 13 лет. Бибитуйдигул хочет заняться скотоводством. Она берет кредит для закупа телят и коровы. Хочет закупить телят для откорма и последующей продажи по более выгодной цене.
texts.en:
Bibituydigul is forty-five years old, married and has four children. She has a high-school level of education and sells men's clothing on the market. She's worked in this field for the past thirteen years but wants to start a business breeding cattle. 
Bibituydigul is asking for a loan to purchase some calves and a cow. She plans to fatten the calves and then sell them for profit.

loans.use: to purchase some calves and a cow.

loans.name: Sdeung's Group

texts.en:
SD., 46, is married and has two children. She is a farmer living in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district. Also, she catches fish and grows vegetables to feed her family. She started farming 15 years ago. 

Currently, SD. leads a group of two female members. She and her group member have been with VisionFund since 2010 and 2009, respectively. She completely repaid her last loan with VisionFund. Now she is requesting a new loan. She wants to buy fertilizer for her rice field. This loan will enable her to grow more rice and she also hopes to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice field.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 54-year- old married man with two children who are working. His wife, Kanini, is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

John has operated a cafe for the past 30 years. His potential clients are the local area villagers. He faces a major challenge of competition from other cafe operators. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the KES 40,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, tea leaves and cooking oil. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, tea leaves and cooking oil.

loans.name: Shukurullo

texts.ru: Шукурулло проживает в районе Джиликул. Ему 20 лет. Он холост. Шукурулло уже 2 года занимается торговлей. У него смешанный ассортимент товара. Он берет кредит для приобретения торговой точки на рынке.
texts.en: Shukurullo lives in the Jilikul district.  He is 20 years old and single.  Shukurullo has been involved in sales for two years.  He has a mixed selection of merchandise.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a new retail outlet at the market.

loans.use: to buy a new retail outlet at the market

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is from Mantic, Tangub City. She is 47 years old. Rebecca is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Rebecca is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo and soaps. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Rebecca is requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP,  which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. 

In 2008, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with five school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Bahati has operated a vegetable grocery for the past two years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of vegetables like tomatoes and onions for her grocery. She decided to join Yehu to access loans.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of vegetables like tomatoes and onions for her grocery.

loans.name: Zayniddin

texts.ru: Зайниддин проживает в районе Джиликул. Он женат. Ему 24 года. У него двое детей. Он уже восемь лет занимается садоводством. Кроме того он занимается выращиванием овощей. Кредит берет для покупки органических и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Zayniddin lives in the Jilikul district.  He is 24 years old, married and has two children.  He has been involved in gardening for eight years.  Besides, Zayniddin is involved in growing vegetables.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of organic and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase organic and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 55-year-old married woman with four children. All of them are in the school. She has a business of selling clothes in Buluk, South Sudan. She has been running this business for four years.

Susan requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 37 years old, married and the father of three children. He has been operating a small retail shop for the last six years, with a monthly profit of KES 12,000. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer, and he is applying for his first loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET. He plans to use the loan to add additional stock of maize flour, cooking oil and washing detergent for sale. 

He will save the anticipated profit and help pay school fees for his children. In the future, Josphat hopes to grow his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, cooking oil and washing detergent for sale.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a married woman with three children. Esterlita is 49 years old, residing at Mantic, Tangub City, Philippines. 

Esterlita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living, and she's been one year in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP. 

She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Esterlita is been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Esterlita hopes to improve and expand her business and to enable her children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 42 years old and lives in Dipolog City. She is married and has two children.
 
Jessica has a sewing business and earns approximately PHP 3,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase textiles and accessories for dressmaking. 

Jessica has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase textiles and accessories for dressmaking.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is married and has eight children. Alicia is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Alicia is a farmer who grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4100 years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her rice fields. 

Alicia has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her rice fields.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with four school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Saumu has operated a posho mill (a maize-grinding machine) for the past three years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase more sacks of maize for her business. She decided to join Yehu because their quality services.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of maize for her business.

loans.name: Jemame

texts.en:
Jemame is 23 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is single and has a 5-year-old child that is currently in school and living at home.

She started her business through her friend and for a year now she has been selling slippers in the market. She said sometimes business goes slow ( the buying), but she makes a lot of profit and has more customers, and she is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for  her business.

She plans to learn a trade and help her child.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, a 35-year-old married mother of two children, has been operating a small retail shop for the last four years, earning a monthly profit of KES 4,000.

Introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, she is applying for her second loan of KES. 30,000 to purchase additional stocks of tea leaves, sweets, and maize flour for sale. Lydia will save the anticipated profit and help pay her children's school fees. In future, she hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy tea leaves, sweets, and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.en:
Gaspar is 37 years old and lives in La Esperanza, Rizal. He is married and has one child.
 
Gaspar has a motorcycle repair business and earns approximately PHP 5,200 each month doing this work. 

He has requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase one unit tractor. 

Gaspar has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: To purchase one unit tractor.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 35-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 10 and 2. Two of them are in the school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan for four years.

Christine requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She says that the extra income from this loan will helps her to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр проживает в районе Джикул. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка. У них пятеро детей. Сам Бахтиёр занимается выращиванием овощей для продажи. Кроме того он сажает фруктовые деревья. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Bakhtiyor lives in the Jilikul region. He's married and has five children. His wife takes care of the household, while Bakhtiyor makes a living by growing vegetables for sale. He also tends to an orchard.
He's asking for a loan in order to buy some mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria, age 56, lives in the village of Nagrumbuan, Cauayan City, Isabela with her husband and five children. Some of her children already have their own families.

To make a living, Gregoria owns and operates a farming business. Her main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP every crop season. She also sells vegetables in the local community for additional income. She needs both sources of income in order to sustain her family's daily needs.

Right now she would like to request a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP in order to purchase seeds, insecticides and fertilizer for her farm production.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, insecticides and fertilizer for her farm production

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin runs a rice-farming business that has an area of 1.2 hectares. He has been managing it for almost 21 years. He is 43 years old, is married, and blessed with four children. Among his four children, one has settled in marriage, and has a separate house; two are still studying, and the other one is still single.

He and his wife are doing some field activities to minimize their labor expenses. However, they still need to hire laborers to be able to keep the expected date of sowing and transplanting, but his capital is not sufficient. So, he is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy certified seeds of rice, fertilizers, herbicides, and to pay for the labor costs of rice farming. He is hoping that he can improve the farm land and provide all the materials needed to care for his rice crop. Through his patience in cultivating and improving his rice fields, he can earn greater profit to make a living. In addition, he can support his two children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as certified seeds of rice, fertilizers, herbicides, and to pay for the labor cost of his farming business.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with two children who are both married. Her husband is a mason who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Umazi has operated a firewood selling business for the past three years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Kamutu

texts.en:
Kamutu is 36 years old, married and the mother of two children. She has been operating a small retail shop for the last four years, with a monthly profit of KES 3,000. 

Kamutu was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer, and she is applying for her second loan of KES 20,000 from the company, which she plans to use to add additional stock of wheat flour, cooking oil, washing soap and other household commodities for sale. 

She will save the anticipated profit and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and own her own well stocked retail shop.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, cooking oil and washing soap for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 33 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has been operating a small retail shop for the last four years, with a monthly profit of KES 6,000. 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Ltd., which she plans to use to add additional stock of maize flour, cooking oil, Royco (a spicy seasoning) and tea leaves for sale. 

The client will save the anticipated profit and help pay school fees for her children. In the future, the lady hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, cooking oil, Royco and tea leaves.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.en:
Herminio is 51 years old, married, and a responsible father to his children. Herminio involved himself in rice farming as source of income; his family relies on his net income and remittances. He had been planting rice for 10 years. According to him, he is not yet an expert in this field of work, and he needs to improve his farming practices. Herminio aims to increase his output because the cost of living is expensive nowadays. 

Herminio is now asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers to use in farming. He hopes to improve crop production.

In the future, Herminio would like to strengthen his business to earn additional revenue and finance the schooling of his four children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers to use in farming.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with four school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. Mwaki owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water, and her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.

Mwaka has operated a paraffin-selling business for the past two years, with neighbors as her customers. She faces a major challenge of transportation, and she dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future. Having decided to join Yehu to access financial aid to expand her business, Mwaka is requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to purchase more liters of paraffin for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more liters of paraffin for resale.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is from Mantic, Tangub City. She is 54 years old, married and has three children. Melba runs a general store, selling a variety of food and personal products such as shampoo,soaps, etc. in the local community . Melba has been in her business for over 2 years, earning 3,000 PHP a month.

Melba is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. In 2009, Melba joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 24 years old, married and a mother of three children. She has been selling fish for the last two years, with a monthly profit of KES 5,000. 

Sandra was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to add more stock of fish for sale. 

Sandra will save the anticipated profit to help pay her children's school fees. In the future, Sandra hopes to grow her business and own a fish depot in the area.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 35 years old, married and has five children between the ages of 7 and 19, all of them in school. She has operated a business selling beer in Buluk, South Sudan for 10 years.

Susan has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beer. She says that the extra income from this loan will helps her build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beer for sale

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 43 years old, married and a father of six children. He owns rental houses and has been in this business for the last six years, earning a monthly profit of KES 15,000. 

Alfred was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. He is applying for his first loan of KES 70,000 from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to complete building new rental houses. Alfred will save the anticipated profit to help pay his children's school fees. In the future, Alfred hopes to grow his business and venture into the real estate business.

loans.use: To complete building new rental houses

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 31 years old, and is married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Ester owns and operates a farming business together with her husband. Her main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ester has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP every season (every four months). She is also engaged in a hog-raising business for their additional income.

Ester needs both sources of income in order to sustain the family's daily needs and to afford sending her children to school. She would like to request a loan in the amount of PHP 20,000 in order to buy seeds, insecticides, and fertilizers for her rice farm production. She hopes that she will make more improvements in her business through this loan, and hopes that her patience and sacrifices will lead her to reach her goals in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, and fertilizers for her rice farm production

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman with no children. She owns a house with piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Rukia has operated a vegetable and dried fish stall for the past three years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation and dreams of expanding her business.

Rukia plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase more stock of dried fish and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu because it gives financial help to low income earners.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Glane

texts.en:
Glane is a married woman having one child. Glane is 30 years old, residing at Happy Valley, Tambulig, ZDS, Philippines. 

Glane owns and operates farmland, planting & harvesting corn for sale to earn a living and she's been two years in this business. Each month, she earns 15,000 doing this type of work. 

She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Glane is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Glane wants to make improvements to her house and to have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

location.town: Happy Valley  Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy serving plates, tea cups, tea spoons, as well as food such as potatoes, onions, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
This is Trinidad, 55, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Erlito, a maintenance staff person, and mother to her five children .She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Trinidad operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Trinidad hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with six children who are enrolled in school. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Grace has operated a vegetable stall for the past two years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

Grace plans to use this KES 15,000 loan to purchase more stocks of potatoes, tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu because it helps low income earners by giving them funds to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more potatoes, tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Natalina

texts.en:
Natalina is a 38-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 14 and 21, all of them in school. She has operated a business selling clothes in Buluk, South Sudan for four years.

Natalina has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will helps her build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is a farmer from the village of Marani, Abasha district. He is 49 years old, married and lives with his family: his wife Galina, his 26-year-old daughter, his 19-year-old son and his parents. Avtandil and Galina are farmers, their daughter works as a pharmacist in a local drugstore and their son is a student. 

The main source of the family's income is agriculture. They have 6 milk cows, producing and selling on average 90 kg of cheese per month to dairy products retailers. The family also has 3 hectares of land, where they grow maize and soybeans. The family usually harvests 6 tons of corn (5 for the family farm and one sold locally). The family's total average monthly income is 950 GEL, including Avtandil’s parents' monthly pensions. 

Avtandil has requested a loan to rent a combine, which will be used for harvesting the soybeans. Avtandil will use part of the harvested soybeans for the family farm and about half of the harvest will be sold on the local market. Avtandil will use the income generated from this loan to cover his son's school fees.

loans.use: to rent a combine for harvesting soybeans

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
Salve, 54, is a single parent living in Manila, Philippines. She and her children manage their own household while operating their business. Salve works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Salve operates a variety store which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg. Salve earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in daily sales.

To help her continue operations of her business, Salve is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Salve hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Boston

texts.en:
Boston is a 34-year-old married man with three school-going children. He owns a house with no electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Boston has operated a retail shop for the past ten years; his potential clients are his neighbors. He dreams of expanding his business.

Boston plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase more stock of maize flour, sugar and soap for resale. He decided to join Yehu because of their fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of maize flour, sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is responsible; he has patiently managed his 1.6 hectares of rice fields for almost 20 years. He is 48 years old, married, and has been blessed with four children. Jerry has been spending his income on their daily needs, and payment for his motorcycle transport.  

Jerry is asking for financial assistance amounting to P25,000 to pay for hired laborers in tilling the farmland and buying farm inputs such as fertilizer and insecticides to improve his rice fields. He is hoping that his requested loan amount will be granted to make his farmland more productive and profitable. He believes that he can obtain plentiful harvest this crop season, which will enable him to save for the future of his children.

loans.use: to pay for hired laborers in tilling the farmland and buying farm inputs such as fertilizer and insecticides to improve his rice fields.

loans.name: Alili

texts.en:
This is Alili, 60, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Juanito, a vendor, and a mother to her three children .She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Alili operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 38,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Alili hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Manny

texts.en: With his desire to improve his crop production, Manny spends most of his time in his farming business. He plants and harvests rice and sells it to traders. He earned approximately PHP 30,000 with his last crop. Profits earned are just enough to cover his daily expenses. Manny is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides used in farming. He wants to ensure more crop production for this next cropping season. In the future, he would like to keep producing an abundant harvest and earn consistent profits to make his family economically stable. He hopes that he will make more development in his business through this loan, and hopes that his patience and sacrifices will lead him to reach his goals in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides used in farming.

loans.name: Zaldie

texts.en:
Zaldie is a patient, hardworking father who endures many difficulties in his business. On his daily schedule, he operates a motorcycle transport business to acquire income, and provides for the needs for his one infant child. He only finished high school, so he was not able to seek employment, and was early to marry. 

He needs to improve his services to gain more profit, so he is asking for a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy new pairs of tires and side mirrors for his motorcycle.

In the future, Zaldie hopes to make his business profitable despite hardships in providing the service.

loans.use: to buy new pairs of tires and side mirrors for the motorcycle

loans.name: Bon Berger Group

texts.fr: Le groupe BON BERGER est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième  fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Sylvie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sylvie est âgée de 31 ans et vit au Bénin. Sylvie  n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Sylvie est mariée à un certain Bernardin. Le couple a un enfant qui est à leur charge. Sylvie vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la famille, Sylvie vend depuis six ans, des charbons de bois et des friperies de façon ambulante. Sylvie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Sylvie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe BON BERGER, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Bon Berger (Good Sheperd) group is composed of three persons who reside in the same neighborhood. This the second time that this group has sought the financial support of ALIDé, to raise the level of its activities. The representative of the group, named Sylvie, is the one with the raised hand on the picture.

Sylvie is 31 years old and lives in Benin. She has not attended school, and is married to Bernardin. The couple has a child who is dependent on them. Sylvie lives together with her husband and child. The couple shares responsibility for household expenses.

Over the past six years Sylvie has help deal with various family expenses by selling charcoal and second-hand clothing, as an itinerant vendor. She gets her supplies from one of Benin's markets.

In her quest for customer satisfaction and to increase her turnover and income, Sylvie, together with the other members of the Bon Berger group, is requesting a second credit loan from ALIDé. The first loan was fully reimbursed.

loans.use: Buy bags of charcoal and second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Kolongolo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kolongolo Group in Western Kenya! Eliud is the facilitator of Kolongolo group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.  Like the majority of people in this part of Kenya, the members of Kolongolo Group are farmers who rely on maize production for yearly food security and income.

Eliud takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Eliud had a very good maize yield, harvesting 9 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Eliud was only able to harvest 2.5 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Eliud  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Eliud will pay for major annual expenses such as school fees and home repair.

In 2012, the members of Kolongolo group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a seamstress, and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She earns reasonably good profits every month. She started this business a few years ago because her husband’s income was not enough to fulfill the needs of the whole family. Shahnaz has given birth to three daughters and three sons; five of them are studying while her elder son left his education after 6th grade, and started a scrap selling business.

He is in the process of establishing his business, and Shahnaz has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to help him. With the loan he will buy scrap in bulk quantity to be able to fulfill his clients' requirements and increase his profits.

Shahnaz is hopeful that an investment will help her son in his business, and he will be able to run it better.


Note: "In the picture, the lady who has passbook (called Asasah passbook) in her hand is Shahnaz."

loans.use: to buy scrap for scrap selling business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 49 years old, a single mother of three school-going children.  She has been selling clothes through hawking  for the last six years, with an income of KES 16,000, a month.

She has never borrowed from any other MFI, and this is her third loan, after successfully repaid the previous loans well and in good time. She plans to buy more clothes for sale.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to support her family and grow her business and get a rental stall to display her clothes for sale. She hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Gisma

texts.en:
Gisma is a 42-year-old married woman with six children between the ages of 8 and 18. She has operated a business selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan for three years. She has one employee.

Gisma has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She says that the extra income from this loan will helps her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mawuwetin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAWUWETIN est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la première  fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Nouratou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Nouratou est âgée de 33 ans.  Nouratou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Nouratou est mariée à un déclarant en douane du nom de Soulemane. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et  à leur charge. Nouratou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de la famille, Nouratou vend depuis cinq ans, divers articles en plastiques dans un marché du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Nouratou vend des oignons. Nouratou s’approvisionne dans au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu,  Nouratou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAWUWETIN, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The MAWUWETIN group is composed of three people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the group’s first time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activities. The representative of the group is Nouratou, seen with her hand raised in the photo. 

Nouratou is 33 years old. She never attended school. She is married to a customs officer named Soulemane, and they have two dependent children who both go to school. Nouratou lives with her husband and children, and the couple provide together for the family’s needs. 

In order to help with the various household expenses, Nouratou started selling plastic ware in a market of Benin five years ago. She also sells onions as a secondary activity. She buys her stock in Togo. 

Eager to meet her customers’ needs and to increase her sales and revenue, Nouratou is seeking a first loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the MAWUWETIN group.

loans.use: to buy onions and plastic items for resale

loans.name: Tumaini B Shg Group

texts.en:
